column2: The fittest survive. What is meant by the fittest? Not the strongest; not the cleverest— Weakness and stupidity everywhere survive. column2: A dreamer is one who can only find his way by moonlight, and his punishment is that he sees the dawn before the rest of the world.

column2: A gentleman is one who never hurts anyone's feelings unintentionally.

column2: A little sincerity is a dangerous thing, and a great deal of it is absolutely fatal.

column2: A man can be happy with any woman, as long as he does not love her.

column2: A man can't be too careful in the choice of his enemies.

column2: A man's face is his autobiography. A woman's face is her work of fiction.

column2: All art is quite useless.

column2: All bad poetry springs from genuine feeling.

column2: Always forgive your enemies - nothing annoys them so much.

column2: Art is the most intense mode of individualism that the world has known.

column2: As long as a woman can look ten years younger than her own daughter, she is perfectly satisfied.
column4: Un femina es perfectemente satisfacte dum illa pote semblar dece annos plus juvene que su proprie filia.

column2: Between men and women there is no friendship possible. There is passion, enmity, worship, love, but no friendship.

column2: Bigamy is having one wife too many. Monogamy is the same.

column2: Education is an admirable thing, but it is well to remember from time to time that nothing that is worth knowing can be taught.
column4: Le education es un cosa admirabile, ma il conveni de rememorar de tempore a tempore que alique que vale le pena de saper non pote esser inseniate.

column2: Every portrait that is painted with feeling is a portrait of the artist, not of the sitter.

column2: Every saint has a past and every sinner has a future.

column2: Everything popular is wrong.

column2: Experience is one thing you can't get for nothing.

column2: Experience is simply the name we give our mistakes.

column2: Hatred is blind, as well as love.

column2: He has no enemies, but is intensely disliked by his friends.

column2: How marriage ruins a man! It is as demoralizing as cigarettes, and far more expensive.

column2: Andorra is a small principality situated between Spain and France.

column2: I like persons better than principles, and I like persons with no principles better than anything else in the world.

column2: There is nothing either good or bad but thinking makes it so.

column2: He that is giddy thinks the world turns round.

column2: After silence, that which comes nearest to expressing the inexpressible is music.

column2: The more powerful and original a mind, the more it will incline towards the religion of solitude.

column2: Experience is not what happens to you; it's what you do with what happens to you.

column2: There are things known and there are things unknown, and in between are the doors of perception.

column2: The end cannot justify the means, for the simple and obvious reason that the means employed determine the nature of the ends produced.

column2: If most of us remain ignorant of ourselves, it is because self-knowledge is painful and we prefer the pleasure of illusion.
column4: Si le majoritate del homines remane ignorante de nostre ver natura, il es proque le cognoscentia de se mesme es alique penose, e assi nos prefere le placer del illusion.

column2: Man approaches the unattainable truth through a succession of errors.

column2: My religion consists of a humble admiration of the illimitable superior spirit who reveals himself in the slight details we are able to perceive with our frail and feeble mind.
column4: Mi religion consiste in un humile admiration del spirito illimitate e superior que se revela mesmo in le detalios minute que nos pote perciper con le debile e ineffective attributos de nostre mente.

column4: Tom va perciper que alique non es correcte.

column2: There's no need to try to translate a phrase word-for-word.
column4: Il non es necesse essayar de traducer un phrase parola pro parola.

column2: You see, but you do not observe.
column4: Tu vide, ma tu non observa.

column2: You can use my computer if you want.
column4: Vos pote usar mi computator si vos lo vole.

column2: The more you know, the more you understand that you know nothing.
column4: Quanto plus uno sape, tanto plus uno comprende que uno sape nihil.

column2: Does he have a pet?
column4: Esque ille habe un animal domestic?

column2: How is the weather in Thessaloniki?
column4: Como es ora le tempore a Thessalonica?

column2: This looks awesome!
column4: Isto es fabulose!

column2: This looks awesome!
column4: Isto es stupende!

column2: How soon can you land? "I can't tell." "You can tell me. I'm a doctor." "No, I mean I'm just not sure!" "Can't you take a guess?" "Well, not for another two hours." "You can't take a guess for another two hours?"
column4: Intra quante tempore pote vos aterrar? "Io non sape dicer lo." "Vos pote dicer me lo, io es un medico." "No, io vole dicer que io non es secur." "Esque vos non pote facer vos un idea?" "Non ante circa duo horas." "Esque vos non pote facer vos un idea ante circa duo horas?"

column2: The Hebrew language continues to evolve.
column4: Le lingua hebree continua a developpar se.

column2: I don't need them to do me any favors.
column4: Io non necessita que uno me face ulle favor.

column2: Old men are dangerous: it doesn't matter to them what is going to happen to the world.
column4: Le vetules es periculose, proque il non les importa lo que va evenir al mundo in le futuro.

column2: A soldier is an anachronism of which we must get rid.
column4: Un soldato es un anachronismo, del qual nos debe liberar nos.

column2: When we know what God is, we shall be gods ourselves.
column4: Quando nos sapera lo que es Deo, nos ipse essera deos.

column2: You look relaxed.
column4: Vos pare relaxate.

column2: He doesn't even know how to swim!
column4: Ille non mesmo sape natar!

column2: A smile sends a friendship signal.
column4: Un surriso invia un signal de amicitate.

column2: What's the minimum salary in Iceland?
column4: Que es le salario minime in Islanda?

column2: A melody is not merely something you can hum.
column4: Melodia non es simplemente alique que on pote cantetar.

column2: Most people use music as a couch; they want to be pillowed on it, relaxed and consoled for the stress of daily living. But serious music was never meant to be soporific.
column4: Multe personas usa le musica como un divan; illes vole que le musica les servi de cossino, les lassa relaxate e reconfortate del tensiones del activitates quotidian. Ma on ha nunquam desirate que le musica serie sia soporifere.

column2: The real tragedy of the poor is the poverty of their aspirations.
column4: Le real tragedia del povres es le povressa de lor aspirationes.

column2: What can be added to the happiness of a man who is in health, out of debt, and has a clear conscience?
column4: Que pote il mancar al felicitate de un homine qui es con bon sanitate, sin debitas, e que habe un conscientia munde?

column2: Chess is the gymnasium of the mind.
column4: Chacos es le gymnasio del intellecto.

column2: A liar will not be believed, even when he speaks the truth.
column4: On non pote creder in un mentitor, mesmo quando ille dice le veritate.

column2: Adventure is worthwhile.
column4: Le aventura vale le pena.

column2: Every truth has two sides; it is as well to look at both, before we commit ourselves to either.
column4: Omne veritate habe duo lateres; il es conveniente de examinar ambes ante de compromitter nos con un de illos.

column2: Example is the best precept.
column4: Le exemplo es le melior precepto.

column2: Gratitude is the sign of noble souls.
column4: Le gratitude es le marca del animas nobile.

column2: He that is discontented in one place will seldom be happy in another.
column4: Ille qui es discontente in un loco rarmente essera felice in altere loco.

column2: Injuries may be forgiven, but not forgotten.
column4: Offensas pote esser pardonate, ma non oblidate.

column2: He who knows nothing is closer to the truth than he whose mind is filled with falsehoods and errors.
column4: Ille qui sape nihil es plus presso al veritate que ille qui ha su mente replete de mentitas et errores.

column2: Art is the lie that enables us to realize the truth.
column4: Arte es le falsitate que nos habilita a comprehender le veritate.

column2: Three things cannot be long hidden: the sun, the moon, and the truth.
column4: Tri cosas on non pote occultar longe tempore: le sol, le luna e le veritate.

column2: He's not German, but Austrian.
column4: Ille non es german, ma austriac.

column2: Brazil is a big country.
column4: Brasil es un pais grande.

column2: She was shot in her sleep.
column4: Illa ha essite fusilate durante que illa dormiva.

column2: Mary pulled out a pistol and shot Tom.
column4: Mary tirava un pistola e fusilava Tom.

column2: Love is the only reality and it is not a mere sentiment. It is the ultimate truth that lies at the heart of creation.
column4: Le amor es le unic realitate e illo non es mer sentimento. Illo es le veritate ultimate que jace in le corde del creation.

column2: Everything we hear is an opinion, not a fact. Everything we see is a perspective, not the truth.
column4: Toto lo que nos audi es un opinion, non un facto. Toto lo que nos vide es un apparentia, non le veritate.

column2: You never find yourself until you face the truth.
column4: Vos nunquam trovara vostre proprie esser usque a que vos confrontara le veritate.

column2: Truth, like gold, is to be obtained not by its growth, but by washing away from it all that is not gold.
column4: Le veritate, assi como le auro, debe esser obtenite non per facer lo crescer, ma per mundar lo de toto lo que non es auro.

column2: Believe those who are seeking the truth. Doubt those who find it.
column4: Crede in illes qui cerca le veritate. Dubita de illes qui lo trova.

column2: Beauty is truth's smile when she beholds her own face in a perfect mirror.
column4: Quando le beltate contempla su proprie facie in un speculo perfecte, le veritate surride.

column2: The seeing of Truth cannot be dualistic (a "thing" seen). It cannot be seen by a see-er, or via a see-er. There can only be a seeing which itself is Truth.
column4: Il es impossibile vider le Veritate de modo dualistic (un "cosa" vidite). Illo non pote esser vidite per alicuno qui reguarda, o per medio del reguardo de alicuno. Il existe solmente le vider, que es le Veritate mesme.

column2: There is no Truth. There is only the truth within each moment.
column4: Il non existe Veritate. Il existe solmente le veritate inherente a cata momento.

column2: If you cannot find the truth right where you are, where else do you expect to find it?
column4: Si tu non pote trovar le veritate exactemente ubi tu es, ubi es il que tu spera trovar lo?

column2: Mind is consciousness which has put on limitations. You are originally unlimited and perfect. Later you take on limitations and become the mind.
column4: Le mente es le conscientia que se ha vestite con limitationes. Vos es originarimente illimitate e perfecte. Ma posteriormente vos assume limitationes e vos deveni le mente.

column2: Silence is most powerful. Speech is always less powerful than silence.
column4: Le silentio es multo potente. Le parlar es semper minus efficace que le silentio.

column2: Don't limit a child to your own learning, for he was born in another time.
column4: Non limita un infante a tu proprie saper, viste que illo ha nascite in un altere tempore.

column2: You made him blush.
column4: Tu le ha facite ruber.

column2: You made him blush.
column4: Tu le ha facite rubescer.

column2: You made him blush.
column4: Tu le ha facite erubescer.

column2: I'll never forget what happened that night.
column4: Io non oblidara jammais lo que eveniva ille nocte.

column2: That man over there asked me who I was.
column4: Ille viro ibi demandava me qui io es.

column2: That was a beautiful speech.
column4: Illo esseva un belle discurso.

column2: German is the only world language that capitalizes all nouns.
column4: Le germano es le unic lingua in le mundo in le qual omne substantivo es scripte con initial majuscule.

column2: The firefighters are trying to bring the flames under control.
column4: Le pumperos essaya de mantener le flammas sub controlo.

column2: Tom never goes to sleep before midnight.
column4: Tom nunquam va al lecto ante medie nocte.

column2: Tom never goes to sleep before midnight.
column4: Tom non va jammais al lecto ante medie nocte.

column2: Tom doesn't visit his parents anymore.
column4: Tom non plus visita su parentes.

column2: My teacher usually gives a lot of homework.
column4: Mi inseniante sole dar multe deberes scholar.

column2: The butcher is cutting the meat.
column4: Le macellero talia le carne.

column2: Won't you be so kind to tell me why?
column4: Non haberea tu le bonitate de dicer me proque?

column2: I see through you.
column4: Io cognosce tu anima profundemente.

column2: I slept and dreamt that life was joy. I awoke and saw that life was service. I acted and behold, service was joy.
column4: Io dormiva et io soniava que vita es allegressa. Io me eveliava et io videva que vita es servicio. Io ageva e, ecce!, servicio es allegressa.

column2: If you shut the door to all errors, truth will be shut out.
column4: Si tu claude le porta a tote le errores, le veritate non potera entrar.

column2: A mind all logic is like a knife all blade. It makes the hand bleed that uses it.
column4: Un mente completemente logic es como un cultello que es solmente lamina. Illo face sanguinar le mano que lo usa.

column2: Death is not extinguishing the light; it is only putting out the lamp because the dawn has come.
column4: Le morte non es extinguer le luce; il es solmente disconnecter le lampa proque le aurora ha arrivate.

column2: Every child comes with the message that God is not yet discouraged of man.
column4: Omne infante apporta nos le message de que Deo crede ancora in le homine.

column2: From the solemn gloom of the temple children run out to sit in the dust, God watches them play and forgets the priest.
column4: Del solemne obscuritate del templo infantes exi currente e va seder se super le terra. Deo observa les durante que illes joca, e ille oblida le prestre.

column2: Music fills the infinite between two souls.
column4: Le musica plena le vacuo infinite que existe inter duo animas.

column2: My heart, the bird of the wilderness, has found its sky in your eyes.
column4: Mi corde, ave de un region salvage, ha trovate su celo in tu oculos.

column2: By plucking her petals, you do not gather the beauty of the flower.
column4: Per eveller su petalos, tu non potera sasir le beltate del flor.

column2: In this playhouse of infinite forms I have had my play, and here have I caught sight of him that is formless.
column4: In iste theatro de formas infinite io ha representate mi pecia, e hic io ha habite un vista de ille qui non habe formas.

column2: It is very simple to be happy, but it is very difficult to be simple.
column4: Il es multo simple de esser felice, ma il es multo difficile de esser simple.

column2: Only in love are unity and duality not in conflict.
column4: Solmente in le amor le unitate e le dualitate non es in conflicto.

column2: Let life be as beautiful as summer flowers. And death as beautiful as autumn leaves.
column4: Que le vita sia si belle como le flores in le estate. E que le morte sia si belle como le folios in le autumno.

column2: God waits to win back his own flowers as gifts from man's hands.
column4: Deo attende que su proprie flores retorna a ille como presentes del manos del homine.

column2: Men are cruel, but Man is kind.
column4: Le homines es cruel, ma le Homine es gentil.

column2: God respects me when I work; but God loves me when I sing.
column4: Deo respecta me quando io lavora; ma Deo ama me quando io canta.

column2: Life's aspirations come in the guise of children.
column4: Le aspirationes del vita veni in le figura de infantes.

column2: The fish in the water is silent, the animal on the earth is noisy, the bird in the air is singing. But Man has in him the silence of the sea, the noise of the earth and the music of the air.
column4: Le pisce in le aqua es silente, le animal super le terra es ruitose, le ave in le aere es cantante. Ma le Homine contine in se le silentio del mar, le ruito del terra e le musica del aere.

column2: Praise shames me, for I secretly beg for it.
column4: Le elogio avergonia me, proque io secretemente busca obtener lo.

column2: Tell me what's on your mind.
column4: Dice me lo que tu pensa.

column2: All that is not given is lost.
column4: Toto que non es date es perdite.

column2: We are hidden in ourselves, like a truth hidden in isolated facts. When we know that this One in us is One in all, then our truth is revealed.
column4: Nos es celate in nos mesme, como un veritate occulte in factos isolate. Quando nos sapera que iste Uno in nos es Uno in toto, alora nostre veritate essera revelate.

column2: You need not aspire for or get any new state. Get rid of your present thoughts, that is all.
column4: Vos non ha besonio de aspirar a attinger ulle nove stato. Libera vos de vostre pensamentos presente, isto suffice.

column2: Every spirit makes its house, and we can give a shrewd guess from the house to the inhabitant.
column4: Omne spirito face su casa, et, ab le casa, nos pote divinar precisemente le habitante.

column2: Every wall is a door.
column4: Omne pariete es un porta.

column2: Every wall is a door.
column4: Omne muro es un porta.

column2: Fiction reveals truth that reality obscures.
column4: Le fiction revela le veritate que es celate per le realitate.

column2: For every minute you remain angry, you give up sixty seconds of peace of mind.
column4: In cata minuta de ira tu perde sexanta secundas de pace de spirito.

column2: Getting old is a fascination thing. The older you get, the older you want to get.
column4: Devenir vetule es alique fascinante. Quanto plus vetule tu deveni, tanto plus vetule tu vole devenir.

column2: It is a fact often observed, that men have written good verses under the inspiration of passion, who cannot write well under other circumstances.
column4: Un facto que on sovente observa il es que, sub le influentia de un passion, bon versos ha essite scripte per personas que, in qualcunque altere circumstantias, non sape scriber ben.

column2: It is not length of life, but depth of life.
column4: Il non es le longor, ma le profunditate del vita (lo que importa).

column2: It is one of the beautiful compensations in this life that no one can sincerely try to help another without helping himself.
column4: Un del belle compensationes in iste vita il es que nemo pote sincermente essayar de adjutar un altere persona sin adjutar se mesme.

column2: It is said that the world is in a state of bankruptcy, that the world owes to the world more than the world can pay.
column4: On dice que le mundo es in stato de fallimento, que le mundo debe al mundo plus que le mundo pote pagar.

column2: Let us be silent, that we may hear the whispers of the gods.
column4: Que nos remane in silentio, pro que nos pote audir le susurros del deos.

column2: Little minds have little worries, big minds have no time for worries.
column4: Parve animas ha parve preoccupationes, grande animas ha nulle tempore pro preoccupationes.

column2: Nature and books belong to the eyes that see them.
column4: Le natura e le libros pertine al oculos que los vide.

column2: Our best thoughts come from others.
column4: Nostre melior pensatas veni del alteres.

column2: I thought I'd never see you alive again.
column4: Io pensava que io non jammais te viderea vive un altere vice.

column2: People only see what they are prepared to see.
column4: Le personas solmente vide lo que illes es preparate a vider.

column2: The decision is in your hands.
column4: Le decision es in tu manos.

column2: The decision is in your hands.
column4: Le decision es in su manos.

column2: The decision is in your hands.
column4: Le decision es in vostre manos.

column2: Tom managed to escape.
column4: Tom succedeva a escappar.

column2: John ran like crazy to the train station to catch the last train.
column4: John curreva velocemente al station ferroviari pro prender le ultime traino.

column2: That's my most secret ambition!
column4: Iste es mi ambition le plus secrete.

column2: I'm shy, but I take care of myself.
column4: Io es timide, ma io prende cura de me mesme.

column2: The future of mankind rests in your hands.
column4: Le futuro del humanitate resta in vostre manos.

column2: She loves him devotedly.
column4: Illa ama le con devotion.

column2: We know little about her personal life.
column4: Nos sape pauco super le vita private de illa.

column2: It's so bitter.
column4: Il es multo amar.

column2: How many students are in the school?
column4: Quante studentes ha il in le schola?

column2: How many students are in the school?
column4: Quante studiantes esque il ha in le schola?

column2: What do I need to pay for that suit?
column4: Quanto debe io pagar pro iste costume?

column2: Use what language you will, you can never say anything but what you are.
column4: Il non importa le lingua que tu usa, tu nunquam potera dicer ulle cosa excepte lo que tu es.

column2: We are always getting ready to live but never living.
column4: Nos es semper super le puncto de apprestar nos a viver, ma nos nunquam vive.

column2: What we seek we shall find; what we flee from flees from us.
column4: Lo que nos cerca nos trovara; illo de que nos fugi, illo fugi de nos.

column2: Though we travel the world over to find the beautiful, we must carry it with us or we find it not.
column4: Ben que nos curre tote le mundo cercante le belle, nos debe portar lo con nos o nos non lo trova.

column2: Tom had the skill set required to successfully do the job.
column4: Tom habeva le insimul de aptitudes requirite pro facer con successo le travalio.

column2: Win as if you were used to it, lose as if you enjoyed it for a change.
column4: Gania como si tu sole de ganiar, perde como si, pro variar, il te place perder.

column2: With the past, I have nothing to do; nor with the future. I live now.
column4: Con le passato io ha nihil a facer; ni con le futuro. Io vive ora.

column2: The king ruled on the island.
column4: Le rege governava le insula.

column2: He has over a million dollars in assets.
column4: Ille habe un activo de plus de un million de dollares.

column2: Let me never fall into the vulgar mistake of dreaming that I am persecuted whenever I am contradicted.
column4: Que io non cade jammais in le error vulgar de imaginar que io es persequite cata vice que on me contradice.

column2: Thank God this week is over!
column4: Gratias a Deo iste septimana es finite!

column2: There are only four hundred demonstrators in the square.
column4: Il ha solmente quatro centos demonstratores in le placia.

column2: Are you in the square?
column4: Esque vos es in le placia?

column2: Are you in the square?
column4: Esque tu es in le placia?

column2: There is properly no history; only biography.
column4: Il non ha propriemente historia; il ha solmente biographia.

column2: Have a safe trip to China!
column4: Que vos face un viage tranquille a China!

column2: Have a safe trip to China!
column4: Que tu face un viage tranquille a China!

column2: I've almost finished listening to the album.
column4: Io ha jam ascoltate quasi tote le album.

column2: You must have your nails done by a specialist.
column4: Vos debe manicurar vostre ungulas per un specialista.

column2: What beer are you drinking?
column4: Que bira esque vos bibe?

column2: What beer are you drinking?
column4: Que bira esque tu bibe?

column2: We hope you're having a great night.
column4: Io spera que vos habe un optime nocte.

column2: I know it's bad.
column4: Io sape que illo es mal.

column2: Everyone knows that by far the happiest and universally enjoyable age of man is the first. What is there about babies which makes us hug and kiss and fondle them, so that even an enemy would give them help at that age?
column4: Tote le mundo sape que, securmente, le etate del homine le plus felice e universalmente agradabile il es le prime. Que es que le infantes habe que face nos imbraciar les, basiar les e caressar les, assi que mesmo un inimico les prestarea adjuta a ille etate?

column2: Humility is truth.
column4: Humilitate es veritate.

column2: The desire to write grows with writing.
column4: Le desiderio de scriber cresce a mesura que on scribe.

column2: When I get a little money I buy books; and if any is left I buy food and clothes.
column4: Quando io gania un pauco de moneta io compra libros; e, si ulle moneta resta, io compra alimento e vestimentos.

column2: Your library is your paradise.
column4: Tu bibliotheca es tu paradiso.

column2: For what is life but a play in which everyone acts a part until the curtain comes down?
column4: Finalmente, que es le vita si non un pecia in le qual cata un de nos joca un rolo usque a que le cortina descende?

column2: There is nothing I congratulate myself on more heartily than on never having joined a sect.
column4: Le facto pro le qual io sincermente me felicita le plus es le facto de que io non ha jammais devenite membro de un secta.

column2: The summit of happiness is reached when a person is ready to be what he is.
column4: Le culmine del felicitate es attingite quando un persona es preste a esser lo que ille es.

column2: It is a sneaking piece of cowardice for Authors to put feigned names to their works, as if like Bastards of their Brain they were afraid to own them.
column4: Il es un acto de coardia dissimulate alicun Autores dar a cognoscer lor obras sub pseudonymos, como si, qual filias bastarde de lor Cerebro, illes timeva posseder los.

column2: Read first the best books. The important thing for you is not how much you know, but the quality of what you know.
column4: Lege primo le libros le plus bon. Lo que es importante pro te es non quanto tu sape, ma le qualitate de illo que tu sape.

column2: You can see it from here.
column4: Tu pote vider lo ab hic.

column2: You can see it from here.
column4: Vos pote vider lo ab hic.

column2: I hope I'm not boring you.
column4: Io spera que io non te molesta.

column2: I hope I'm not boring you.
column4: Io spera que io non vos molesta.

column2: A human being is part of the whole, called by us Universe, a part limited in time and space. He experiences himself, his thoughts and feelings as something separated from the rest — a kind of optical delusion of his consciousness. This delusion is a kind of prison for us, restricting us to our personal desires and to affection for a few persons nearest to us. Our task must be to free ourselves from this prison by widening our circle of compassion to embrace all living creatures and the whole of nature in its beauty.
column4: Cata esser human es parte del toto que nos nomina Universo, un parte limitate in le tempore e in le spatio. Ille percipe se mesme, su pensatas e sentimentos como alique separate del resto — un sorta de illusion optic de su conscientia. Iste illusion es un sorta de prision pro nos, post que illo restringe nos a nostre desiros personal e al affecto que nos senti pro parve numero de personas qui es bastante proxime a nos. Nostre deber es liberar nos de iste prision per allargar nostre circulo de compassion pro imbraciar tote le creaturas vive e tote le natura in su beltate.

column2: Be a loner. That gives you time to wonder, to search for the truth. Have holy curiosity. Make your life worth living.
column4: Que il te place esser sol. Isto te dara tempore pro voler saper, pro cercar le veritate. Que tu habe un curiositate innocente. Face que tu vita merita esser vivite.

column2: I believe in one thing — that only a life lived for others is a life worth living.
column4: Io crede in un sol cosa — que solmente un vita vivite pro le alteres es digne de esser vivite.

column2: Any man who can drive safely while kissing a pretty girl is simply not giving the kiss the attention it deserves.
column4: Qualcunque homine qui potera guidar in securitate durante que ille basia un belle puera, ille simplemente non dara al basio le attention que illo merita.

column2: There are two ways to live: you can live as if nothing is a miracle; you can live as if everything is a miracle.
column4: Il ha duo manieras de viver: on pote viver sin considerar ulle cosa como un miraculo; o on pote viver vidente in cata cosa un miraculo.

column2: No one seems to know what happened to Tom.
column4: Il sembla que nemo sape lo que ha evenite a Tom.

column2: No one seems to know where Tom went.
column4: Il sembla que nemo sape a ubi ha vadite Tom.

column2: No one seems to know why Tom isn't here.
column4: Il pare que nemo sape proque Tom non es hic.

column2: Tom and Mary soon became best friends.
column4: Tom e Mary ha tosto devenite optime amicos.

column2: Tom thought Mary was asleep.
column4: Tom ha pensate que Mary esseva dormiente.

column2: The intuitive mind is a sacred gift and the rational mind is a faithful servant. We have created a society that honours the servant and has forgotten the gift.
column4: Le mente intuitive es un dono sacrate e le mente rational es un servitor fidel. Nos ha create un societate que honora le servitor e oblidava le dono.

column2: I want to know how God created this world. I'm not interested in this or that phenomenon, in the spectrum of this or that element. I want to know His thoughts, the rest are details.
column4: Io vole saper como Deo creava iste mundo. Io non es interessate in iste o ille phenomeno, in le spectro de iste o ille elemento. Io vole cognoscer Su pensamentos, le resto es detalios.

column2: I am fascinated by Spinoza's pantheism, but I admire even more his contribution to modern thought because he is the first philosopher to deal with the soul and body as one, and not two separate things.
column4: Io es fascinate per le pantheismo de Spinoza, ma io admira ancora plus su contribution al pensamento moderne proque ille es le prime philosopho a tractar del anima e corpore como un unitate, e non como duo cosas separate.

column2: Who would have thought around 1900 that in fifty years time we would know so much more and understand so much less.
column4: Qui haberea pensate, circa 1900, que in un periodo de cinquanta annos, nos haberea de saper tanto plus e comprender tanto minus?

column2: It is only to the individual that a soul is given.
column4: Il es solmente al individuo que un anima es date.

column2: If you are not going forward, you're going backward.
column4: Qui non avantia vade retro.

column2: My dog is clean.
column4: Mi can es munde.

column2: Law is born from despair of human nature.
column4: Le lege nasce del despero del natura human.

column2: I wanted to say something to him, but I didn't.

column2: All my best thoughts were stolen by the ancients.
column4: Tote mi melior pensatas esseva furate per le ancianos.

column4: Le amor es alique magnific.

column4: Ci es Tatoeba.

column2: My humility makes me proud.

column2: Dalhalla offers 20-25 events each summer, from June to September, and the program includes both opera performances and shows/concerts in many different music styles.
column4: Dalhalla offere 20-25 eventos cata estate, de junio a septembre, e le programma include e presentationes de operas e shows/concertos in multe stylos musical differente.

column2: They spend a lot of time together.
column4: Illes passa longe tempore insimul.

column2: A furnace is an enclosed chamber in which heat is produced to heat buildings, destroy refuse, smelt or refine ores, etc.
column4: Un fornace es un spatio claudite ubi calor es producite pro calefacer edificios, destruer immunditias, funder o raffinar minerales, etc.

column2: Why, of course, the people don't want war. Why would some poor slob on a farm want to risk his life in a war when the best that he can get out of it is to come back to his farm in one piece? Naturally, the common people don't want war; neither in Russia nor in England nor in America, nor for that matter in Germany. That is understood. But, after all, it is the leaders of the country who determine the policy and it is always a simple matter to drag the people along, whether it is a democracy or a fascist dictatorship or a Parliament or a Communist dictatorship. [...] Voice or no voice, the people can always be brought to the bidding of the leaders. That is easy. All you have to do is tell them they are being attacked and denounce the pacifists for lack of patriotism and exposing the country to danger. It works the same way in any country.
column4: Ben, naturalmente le plebe non vole le bello. Proque alicun povre rustico a un ferma volerea riscar su vita per un bello quando le melior que ille pote ganiar es retornar in un pecia? Naturalmente, le plebe non vole le bello; ni in Russia ni in Anglaterra ni in America, ni vermente in Germania. Illo es comprendite. Ma post toto, il es le leaders del pais qui determina le politica, e il es semper un cosa facile de traher le plebe al decision, an il es un democratia an un dictatura fascista an un parlamento an un dictatura communista. [...] Con un voce o sin un voce, le plebe semper pote esser ducte al voler del leaders. Illo es facile. Tote lo que tu debe facer es asserer que illos son attaccate, e denunciar le pacifistas a causa de manco de patriotismo e le exponer del pais a periculo. Il functiona mesmo in qualcunque pais.

column2: Solidarity is a weapon.
column4: Le solidaritate es un arma.

column2: You have a sense of humour. I like that.
column4: Vos ha senso de humor. Isto me place.

column2: This book belongs to the school library.
column4: Iste libro pertine al bibliotheca del schola.

column2: In autumn the migratory birds fly south.
column4: In le autumno le aves migratori vola in direction del sud.

column2: Is it the truth?
column4: Esque isto es le veritate?

column2: Life is full of secrets.
column4: Le vita es plen de secretos.

column2: We think, dream and remember in pictures and carry within us a large internal archive.
column4: Nos pensa, sonia e rememora nos per imagines, e nos porta con nos un grande archivo interne.

column2: The eyewitnesses gave conflicting accounts of what they had seen.
column4: Il esseva contradictori le declarationes del testes ocular super lo que illes habeva vidite.

column2: It is evident that the Earth is round.
column4: Il es evidente que le terra es rotunde.

column2: To know what is right and choose to ignore it is the act of a coward.
column4: Saper lo que es juste e eliger ignorar lo es un acto de coardia.

column2: Every Sunday the cat sits on the windowsill and watches the birds.
column4: Cata dominica le catto sede super le appoio del fenestra e observa le aves.

column2: The children competed with each other for their mother's attention.
column4: Le infantes competeva le un con le alteres pro le attention de lor matre.

column2: Thank you, Goddess, mother of the earth, for calling me again into the world.
column4: Gratias, Dea, matre del terra, pro advocar me de nove a in le mundo.

column2: Virtues! Who knows what virtues are? Not you. Not I. Not anyone.
column4: Virtutes! Qui sape lo que es virtutes? Ni vos, ni io, ni ulle homine.

column2: Keep love in your heart. A life without it is like a sunless garden when the flowers are dead.
column4: Guarda amor in tu corde. Le vita sin amor es como le jardin cuje flores es morte per manco del luce solar.

column2: Who can calculate the orbit of his own soul?
column4: Qui pote calcular le orbita de su proprie anima?

column2: We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars.
column4: Nos omnes es in le guttiera, ma alicun de nos contempla le astros.

column2: You're my teacher and my wife!
column4: Tu es mi inseniante e mi sponsa.

column2: Everything is perfect because you exist.
column4: Toto es perfecte perque tu existe.

column2: The lake is completely frozen over.
column4: Le laco es completemente congelate.

column2: Can I work here?
column4: Pote io laborar ci?

column2: Society exists only as a mental concept; in the real world there are only individuals.
column4: Le societate existe solmente como un idea; in le mundo real il ha solmente individuos.

column2: Who, being loved, is poor?
column4: Qui, essente amate, es povre?

column2: Death must be so beautiful. To lie in the soft brown earth, with the grasses waving above one's head, and listen to silence. To have no yesterday, and no tomorrow. To forget time, to forgive life, to be at peace.
column4: Le morte debe esser multo belle. Jacer in le terra molle e brun, con le herbas undulante supra nostre capite, e ascoltar le silentio. Haber nulle heri, nulle deman. Oblidar le tempore, pardonar le vita, esser in pace.

column2: Where would you like to go?
column4: A ubi volerea tu ir?

column2: Let's get started!
column4: Que nos comencia!

column2: We need to take that bus.
column4: Nos debe prender ille bus.

column2: True love is like ghosts, which everyone talks about and few have seen.
column4: Le ver amor es como le phantasmas, super le quales tote le mundo parla, ma que pauches ha vidite.

column2: Fortune knocks but once, but misfortune has much more patience.
column4: Le felicitate batte un sol vice a tu porta, ma le infortuna es plus patiente.

column2: All the world speaks English.
column4: Le mundo integre parla le anglese.

column2: You still love her, don't you?
column4: Tu ama la ancora, nonne?

column2: When it rains, he feels blue.
column4: Ille se senti triste quando il pluve.

column2: He was giving a speech at the park.
column4: Ille faceva un discurso in le parco.

column2: An apple is a tasty fruit.
column4: Le pomo es un fructo gustose.

column2: I am not afraid of death, I just don't want to be there when it happens.
column4: Io non ha timor del morte, io solmente non vole esser illac quando il evenira.

column2: I was thrown out of college for cheating on the metaphysics exam; I looked into the soul of the boy sitting next to me.
column4: Io esseva excludite del schola pro fraudar al examine de metaphysica: io spiava in le anima del puero sedente juxta me.

column2: I can't listen to that much Wagner. I start getting the urge to conquer Poland.
column4: Io non pote ascoltar Wagner longemente. Io comencia a sentir me impellite a conquirer Polonia.

column2: I had a terrible education. I attended a school for emotionally disturbed teachers.
column4: Io ha habite un education terribile. Io frequentava un schola pro inseniantes emotionalmente disturbate.

column2: Maybe the poets are right. Maybe love is the only answer.
column4: Forsan le poetas ha ration. Forsan le amor es le unic responsa.

column2: I took a speed-reading course and read War and Peace in twenty minutes. It involves Russia.
column4: Io sequeva un curso de lectura rapide, e io ha legite Guerra e Pace in vinti minutas. Le trama include Russia.

column2: Love is the answer. But while you're waiting for the answer, sex raises some pretty good questions.
column4: Le amor es le responsa. Ma, durante que on attende le responsa, le sexo pone alicun questiones multo interessante.

column2: I'm such a good lover because I practice a lot on my own.
column4: Io es un amante tanto competente proque io practica bastante sol.

column2: I'm very proud of my gold pocket watch. My grandfather, on his deathbed, sold me this watch.
column4: Mi horologio de auro (de tasca) inorgolia me multo. Mi avo, in su lecto de morte, me ha vendite iste horologio.

column2: I've never been an intellectual but I have this look.
column4: Io non ha jammais essite un intellectual, ma io habe iste aere.

column2: If my films don't show a profit, I know I'm doing something right.
column4: Si mi films non produce lucro, io sapera que alique io face ben.

column2: Most of the time I don't have much fun. The rest of the time I don't have any fun at all.
column4: Le major parte del tempore io non me diverte multo. Le resto del tempore io non me diverte del toto.

column2: There are worse things in life than death. Have you ever spent an evening with an insurance salesman?
column4: In le vita il ha cosas pejor que le morte. Habera tu jam passate un nocte con un agente de assecurantias?

column2: Interestingly, according to modern astronomers, space is finite. This is a very comforting thought — particularly for people who can never remember where they have left things.
column4: Curiosemente, de accordo con le astronomos actual, le spatio es finite. Isto es un notion multo consolatori — particularmente pro le personas qui non se rememora jammais ubi illes ha lassate le cosas.

column2: To a man standing on the shore, time passes quicker than to a man on a boat — especially if the man on the boat is with his wife.
column4: Pro un homine stante super le plagia, le tempore passa plus rapidemente que pro un homine in un barca — specialmente si le homine in le barca es con su sponsa.

column2: The universe is merely a fleeting idea in God's mind — a pretty uncomfortable thought, particularly if you've just made a down payment on a house.
column4: Le universo es simplemente un idea fugace in le mente de Deo — lo que es multo preoccupante, particularmente si tu ha justo ora pagate un amortisation del hypotheca de tu casa.

column2: The war is over.
column4: Le guerra es finite.

column2: A gifted person ought to learn English (barring spelling and pronouncing) in thirty hours, French in thirty days, and German in thirty years.
column4: Un persona intelligente pote apprender anglese (excepte orthographia e pronunciation) in trenta horas, francese in trenta dies e germano in trenta annos.

column2: This song is for you.
column4: Iste cantion es pro te.

column2: This song is for you.
column4: Iste cantion es pro vos.

column2: Please don't translate this sentence.
column4: Non traducer iste phrase, per favor.

column2: If you have an apple and I have an apple and we exchange these apples then you and I will still each have one apple. But if you have an idea and I have an idea and we exchange these ideas, then each of us will have two ideas.
column4: Si tu ha un pomo e io ha un pomo, e nos excambia iste pomos, alora tu e io ha ancora cata uno un pomo. Ma si tu ha un idea e io ha un idea, e nos excambia iste ideas, alora cata un de nos habera duo ideas.

column2: Dancing is a perpendicular expression of a horizontal desire.
column4: Le dansa es un expression vertical de un desiro horizontal.

column2: Better never than late.
column4: Il vale melio nunquam que tarde.

column2: Choose silence of all virtues, for by it you hear other men's imperfections, and conceal your own.
column4: De tote le virtutes elige le silentio, nam in illo tu audi le imperfectiones del altere homines, e tu cela le tues.

column2: Few people think more than two or three times a year; I have made an international reputation for myself by thinking once or twice a week.
column4: Pauc personas pensa plus que duo o tres vices per anno; io me ha facite un reputation international per pensar un o duo vices per septimana.

column2: If there was nothing wrong in the world there wouldn't be anything for us to do.
column4: Si il habeva nulle cosa incorrecte in le mundo, nos non haberea ulle cosa pro facer.

column2: It's easier to replace a dead man than a good picture.
column4: Il es plus facile de substituer a un persona qui moriva, que a un bon pictura.

column2: Miracles, in the sense of phenomena we cannot explain, surround us on every hand: life itself is the miracle of miracles.
column4: Miraculos, in le senso de phenomenos que nos non sape explicar, circumfere nos de omne lateres: le vita mesme es le miraculo del miraculos.

column2: There are many holidays in Brazil.
column4: Il ha multe dies feriate in Brasil.

column2: Only on paper has humanity yet achieved glory, beauty, truth, knowledge, virtue, and abiding love.
column4: Usque ora, solmente super papiro le humanitate ha attingite gloria, beltate, veritate, scientia, virtute e amor permanente.

column2: Patriotism is your conviction that this country is superior to all others because you were born in it.
column4: Patriotismo es tu conviction de que un pais es superior a tote le alteres proque tu nasceva in illo.

column2: Reading made Don Quixote a gentleman, but believing what he read made him mad.
column4: Leger faceva de Don Quixote un gentilhomine, ma creder lo que ille habeva legite le ha facite folle.

column2: We want to add our voices to the conversation.
column4: Nos vole adder nostre voces al conversation.

column2: Science never solves a problem without creating ten more.
column4: Le scientia non solve jammais un problema sin crear dece plus.

column2: The library is the meeting place of all human dreams.
column4: Le bibliotheca es le puncto de incontro de tote le sonios del humanitate.

column2: She had lost the art of conversation but not, unfortunately, the power of speech.
column4: Illa habeva perdite le arte de conversar, ma non, infortunatemente, le capacitate de parlar.

column2: Socialism is the same as Communism, only better English.
column4: Socialismo es le mesme cosa que Communismo, dicite in melior interlingua.

column2: Statistics show that of those who contract the habit of eating, very few survive.
column4: Le statistiches revela que de illes qui contrahe le habito de mangiar, multo pauches supervive.

column2: The best place to find God is in a garden. You can dig for him there.
column4: Le loco le plus bon pro trovar Deo es un jardin. Excavar ibi es un bon maniera de cercar lo.

column2: Virtue consists, not in abstaining from vice, but in not desiring it.
column4: Le virtute consiste, non in abstiner se del vitio, ma in non desirar lo.

column2: Virtue is insufficient temptation.
column4: Virtute es tentation insufficiente.

column2: We don't stop playing because we grow old; we grow old because we stop playing.
column4: Nos non cessa de jocar como le infantes proque nos invetera; nos invetera proque nos cessa de jocar como le infantes.

column2: You must not suppose, because I am a man of letters, that I never tried to earn an honest living.
column4: Vos non debe supponer que, essente un homine del litteras, io ha nunquam essayate de ganiar mi vita honestemente.

column2: In an ugly and unhappy world the richest man can purchase nothing but ugliness and unhappiness.
column4: In un mundo fede e infelice le homine le plus ric pote comprar nihil si non feditate e infelicitate.

column2: The reformer for whom the world is not good enough finds himself shoulder to shoulder with him that is not good enough for the world.
column4: Le reformista pro qui le mundo non es bastante bon sta al latere de ille qui non es bastante bon pro le mundo.

column2: I was conscripted into the army.
column4: Io ha essite conscripte a in le armea.

column2: I have decided to release all my English sentences, including this one.
column4: Io decideva liberar tote mi phrases anglese, inclusive iste.

column2: What's the English for "Ich weiß nicht"? - I don't know. - What the hell, whoever I ask doesn't know!
column4: Como on dice in interlingua "Ich weiß nicht"? — Io non sape. — Ma que inferno, tote le gente a qui io demanda, dice que illes non sape.

column2: Those who understand evil pardon it.
column4: Illes qui comprende le mal, illes lo pardona.

column2: If you begin by sacrificing yourself to those you love, you will end by hating those to whom you have sacrificed yourself.
column4: Si vos comencia a sacrificar vos pro illes qui vos ama, vos finira per odiar illes pro qui vos ha sacrificate vos.

column2: It will take some time.
column4: Illo demandara alicun tempore.

column2: I'm afraid this is an incorrect formulation of the question.
column4: Io pensa que iste maniera de formular le question es incorrecte.

column2: Revolutionary movements attract those who are not good enough for established institutions as well as those who are too good for them.
column4: Le movimentos revolutionari attrahe e illes qui non es bastante bon pro le institutiones existente e illes qui es troppo bon pro illos.

column2: Dancing: the vertical expression of a horizontal desire legalized by music.
column4: Dansar: expression vertical de un desiro horizontal legalisate per le musica.

column2: Life is a flame that is always burning itself out, but it catches fire again every time a child is born.
column4: Le vita es un flamma que es semper super le puncto de extinguer se, ma que de novo se accende cata vice que nasce un infante.

column2: Chess is a foolish expedient for making idle people believe they are doing something very clever when they are only wasting their time.
column4: Chacos es un expediente stupide pro facer personas disoccupate creder que illes face alique multo intelligente quando illes simplemente perde lor tempore.

column2: Common sense is instinct. Enough of it is genius.
column4: Bon senso es instincto. Dose sufficiente de illo es genio.

column2: It's snowing outside.
column4: Il niva foras.

column2: What are you doing in a dark place like that?
column4: Que face tu in un loco obscur como iste?

column2: I'm easily influenced.
column4: Io es facilemente influentiate.

column2: Is it true that horses sleep while standing up?
column4: Es il ver que le cavallos dormi stante?

column2: The churches must learn humility as well as teach it.
column4: Le ecclesias debe non solmente inseniar humilitate, ma anque apprender lo.

column2: It is the deed that teaches, not the name we give it. Murder and capital punishment are not opposites that cancel one another, but similars that breed their kind.
column4: Lo que insenia es le facto, non le nomine que nos da a illo. Assassinato e pena capital non es oppositos que cancella le un le altere, ma similares que prolifica lor proprie specie.

column2: Revolutions have never lightened the burden of tyranny: they have only shifted it to another shoulder.
column4: Le revolutiones non ha jammais alleviate le onere del tyrannia; illos ha solmente displaciate lo a super altere humeros.

column2: No man is good enough to be another man's master.
column4: Necun homine es tanto bon que ille pote devenir maestro de un altere homine.

column2: It's clearly Tom's responsibility.
column4: Il es clarmente le responsabilitate de Tom.

column2: It's clearly Tom's responsibility.
column4: Le responsabilitate incumbe clarmente a Tom.

column2: She wore a yellow ribbon.
column4: Illa usava un banda decorative jalne.

column2: The kitten is playing in the rain.
column4: Le catton joca in le pluvia.

column2: His ancestors would be proud.
column4: Le ascendentes de ille se honorarea de isto.

column2: My back is killing me.
column4: Mi dorso me occide.

column2: Mary often wears revealing clothes.
column4: Mary sovente usa vestimentos revelator.

column2: I get a headache just hearing the name "Tom."
column4: Io habe un mal de testa simplemente per audir le nomine "Tom".

column2: Can you spell "Massachusetts"?
column4: Esque tu sape delitterar "Massachusetts"?

column2: Can I come tomorrow too?
column4: Pote io venir anque deman?

column2: I usually sleep soundly.
column4: Habitualmente io dormi profundemente.

column2: I usually sleep soundly.
column4: Habitualmente io ha un somno profunde.

column2: The little girl's doll is broken.
column4: Le pupa del parve puera es rumpite.

column2: You must write more neatly.
column4: Tu debe scriber plus nettemente.

column2: You have come too soon.
column4: Tu ha venite troppo tosto.

column2: Lovely flowers are growing everywhere.
column4: Flores gratiose cresce ubique.

column2: I will be happy to go.

column4: Le campatores sedeva circa le foco.

column2: A little girl with a kitten sat near me.

column2: If I am what I have and if I lose what I have who then am I?
column4: Si io es lo que io habe e si io perde lo que io habe, alora qui es io?

column2: The mother-child relationship is paradoxical and, in a sense, tragic. It requires the most intense love on the mother's side, yet this very love must help the child grow away from the mother, and to become fully independent.
column4: Le relation matre-infante es paradoxe e, in certe senso, tragic. Illo require le amor le plus intense del latere del matre, totevia iste mesme amor debe adjutar le infante a crescer longe del matre e a devenir totalmente independente.

column2: Education makes machines which act like men and produces men who act like machines.
column4: Le education fabrica machinas que age como homines, e produce homines que age como machinas.

column2: There is only one meaning of life: the act of living itself.
column4: Le vita habe un sol signification: le acto mesme de viver.

column2: Why should society feel responsible only for the education of children, and not for the education of all adults of every age?
column4: Proque le societate debe assumer le responsabilitate del education solmente del infantes e non anche de tote le adultos de quecunque etate?

column2: You're ugly, but I love you anyway.
column4: Tu es fede, ma comocunque io te ama.

column2: You're ugly, but I love you anyway.
column4: Tu es fede, ma in qualcunque maniera io te ama.

column2: Man can be defined as the animal that can say I, that can be aware of himself as a separate entity.
column4: On pote definir le homine como le animal que es capace de dicer io, que pote esser consciente de se mesme como un entitate separate.

column2: Love makes the time pass. Time makes the love pass.
column4: Le amor face passar le tempore. Le tempore face le amor passar.

column2: Silence is true wisdom's best reply.
column4: Le responsa le plus bon que le ver sagessa da es le silentio.

column2: The day is for honest men, the night for thieves.
column4: Le die es pro le homines honeste; le nocte, pro le fures.

column2: He was a wise man who originated the idea of God.
column4: Il esseva un sagio le homine qui dava origine al idea de Deo.

column2: New faces have more authority than accustomed ones.
column4: Nove autoritates es plus effective que illes a qui on jam se ha accostumate.

column2: Youth is the best time to be rich, and the best time to be poor.
column4: Le juventute es le melior tempore pro esser ric, e le melior tempore pro esser povre.

column2: Something's wrong, but I don't know what.
column4: Alique es incorrecte, ma io non sape lo que il es.

column4: Le mascottes official del Jocos Olympic de Hiberno de Sochi 2014 es le Urso Polar, le Lepore, le Leopardo e duo esseres extraterrestre nominate le Flocco de Nive e le Radio de Luce.

column2: We spent a lot of time together.
column4: Nos passava multe tempore insimul.

column2: I'm listening to Celtic music.
column4: Io ora ascolta musica celtic.

column4: Io non ha ancora renovate le casa.

column4: Tres elevate al cubo es vinti-septe.

column4: Esque isto ha jammais evenite a te?

column2: She seems totally at peace with herself.
column4: Apparentemente, illa es toto in pace con se mesme.

column2: He had a leg amputated.
column4: Ille habeva un gamba amputate.

column2: That was the most disgusting thing I've ever tasted.

column4: Le traductor esseva considerate como un "filtro neutre".

column4: Le traductores es personas responsabile qui interpreta.

column4: Traducer e esser interprete involve grande responsabilitates.

column4: Iste interpretation es subjective.

column2: Some words have double meanings.
column4: Certe parolas ha duple signification.

column2: Can we trust him?
column4: Esque nos pote confider in ille?

column2: We trusted her.
