column2: Don't find fault, find a remedy.
column4: Non cercar defectos, trova un correctivo.

column2: Sentence # 3066511 in Tatoeba is sentence # 10000 in interlingua.
column4: Le phrase # 3066511 in Tatoeba es le phrase # 10000 in interlingua.

column2: I was denied access to his land.
column4: On me ha negate le accesso a su terra.

column2: You only have one life. Live it happily and successfully.
column4: Vos ha solmente un vita. Vive lo felice- e eficacemente.

column2: The English language became prevalent around the world for many reasons.
column4: Le lingua anglese deveniva prevalente in tote le mundo pro multe rationes.

column2: Were you there before?
column4: Esque vos esseva ibi antea?

column2: What do you suggest that we do now?
column4: Que suggere vos que nos face ora?

column2: You are really talented.
column4: Vos es realmente talentose.

column2: Stay with us! You will learn fresh and interesting news earlier than every other inhabitant of our planet. Tatoeba: Always a good choice.
column4: Resta hic! Assi, vos cognoscera novas recente e interessante plus tosto que qualcunque altere habitante de nostre planeta. Tatoeba es sempre un bon election.

column2: She has written several books.
column4: Illa ha scribite plure libros.

column2: Bring me some water, would you?
column4: Da me aqua, per favor.

column2: I'll do it tomorrow. I promise.
column4: Io lo facera deman. Io lo promitte.

column2: She asked him to marry her.
column4: Illa le peteva que ille se maritava con illa.

column2: Mary was convinced that she would never get married.
column4: Mary esseva convicte que illa nunquam se maritarea.

column2: Mary was convinced that she would never get married.
column4: Mary esseva convicte que illa non se maritarea jammais.

column2: Fortunately, common sense prevailed and the strike was called off.
column4: Fortunatemente, le bon senso prevaleva e le exopero ha essite cancellate.

column2: Why would anyone want to attack Tatoeba?
column4: Proque alicun persona volerea attaccar Tatoeba?

column2: Let's call it a night.
column4: Pro iste nocte, il suffice.

column2: I don't have an accent!
column4: Io non ha un accento!

column2: She has had multiple plastic surgeries, including breast augmentations and a nose job.
column4: Illa ha facite multiple chirurgias plastic, inclusive augmentation del mammas e remodellation del naso.

column2: The words escaped my lips.
column4: Le parolas escappava de mi labios.

column2: You'd better come inside.
column4: Il vale melio que vos entra.

column2: Forbidden fruit tastes sweetest.
column4: Le fructo prohibite es le plus dulce.

column2: Disease is all too often one of the concomitants of poverty.
column4: Le maladia es con extreme frequentia uno del companias del povressa.

column2: I don't think you'll like the alternative.
column4: Io non crede que le alternativa te placera.

column2: Her eclectic taste was evident from the unusual decor of the room.
column4: Su gusto eclectic esseva ponite in evidentia in le decoration inusual per illa facite in le sala.

column2: Could you tell me what this is all about?
column4: Pote tu dicer me lo que significa toto isto?

column2: Did you have something you wanted to say?
column4: Esque tu voleva dicer me alique?

column2: Did you have something you wanted to say?
column4: Esque tu habeva alique a dicer me?

column2: I need to buy some rat poison.
column4: Io necessita comprar veneno pro rattos.

column2: Where's Toronto?
column4: Ubi es Toronto?

column2: I fear the day when technology will surpass our human interaction. The world will have a generation of idiots.
column4: Io time le die in que le technologia superpassara le interaction human. Le mundo habera un generation de idiotas.

column2: How long until my order arrives?
column4: Depost quante tempore va arrivar mi commanda?

column2: Canada is awesome!
column4: Canada es phantastic!

column2: Welcome to the family, Mina!
column4: Benvenite al familia, Mina!

column2: Do not disturb, I'm studying languages!
column4: Non turbar, io studia linguas!

column2: If there is no God, everything is permitted.
column4: Si Deo non existe, toto es permittite.

column2: To kill someone for committing murder is a punishment incomparably worse than the crime itself.
column4: Occider alicuno pro committer homicidio es un punition incomparabilemente pejor que le crimine mesme.

column2: It's easier for a Russian to become an atheist than for anyone else in the world.
column4: Il es plus facile pro un russo devenir un atheista que pro qualcunque altere persona in le mundo.

column2: It's easier for a Russian to become an atheist than for anyone else in the world.
column4: Il es plus facile que un russo deveni atheista que qualcunque altere persona in le mundo.

column2: There is nothing more deceptive than an obvious fact.
column4: Il ha nihil plus deceptive que un facto obvie.

column2: Any truth is better than indefinite doubt.
column4: Qualcunque veritate es melior que le dubita indefinite.

column2: Elementary, my dear Watson.
column4: Elementari, mi car Watson.

column2: What one man can invent another can discover.
column4: Lo que un homine pote inventar un altere homine pote discoperir.

column2: The life of a man is of no greater importance to the universe than that of an oyster.
column4: Le vita de un homine non es plus importante pro le universo que illo de un ostrea.

column2: The law always limits every power it gives.
column4: Le lege sempre limita tote le poter que illo concede.

column2: To hate, to love, to think, to feel, to see; all this is nothing but to perceive.
column4: Odiar, amar, pensar, sentir, vider: toto isto es nihil plus que perciper.

column2: Truth springs from argument amongst friends.
column4: Le veritate sali del discussion inter amicos.

column2: It is as absurd to say that a man can't love one woman all the time as it is to say that a violinist needs several violins to play the same piece of music.
column4: Il es si absurde dicer que un homine non pote amar sempre le mesme femina como dicer que il es necesse a un violinista plure violinos pro toccar le mesme pecia musical.

column2: The majority of husbands remind me of an orangutan trying to play the violin.
column4: Le majoritate del maritos rememora me un orang-utan essayante de toccar al violino.

column2: True love is eternal, infinite, and always like itself. It is equal and pure, without violent demonstrations: it is seen with white hairs and is always young in the heart.
column4: Le ver amor es eternal, infinite e sempre fidel a se mesme. Illo es constante e pur, sin demonstrationes violente: illo es vidite con capillos blanc e illo es sempre juvene in le corde.

column2: A good husband is never the first to go to sleep at night or the last to awake in the morning.
column4: Un bon marito es nunquam le prime a ir dormir in le nocte ni le ultime a eveliar se in le matino.

column2: A man is a poor creature compared to a woman.
column4: Le homine es un povre creatura comparate con le femina.

column2: A woman knows the face of the man she loves as a sailor knows the open sea.
column4: Un femina cognosce le facie del homine qui illa ama assi como un marinero cognosce le mar aperte.

column2: Bureaucracy is a giant mechanism operated by pygmies.
column4: Bureaucratia es un mechanismo gigantesc operate per pygmeos.

column2: Equality may perhaps be a right, but no power on earth can ever turn it into a fact.
column4: Equalitate pote forsan esser un derecto, ma il ha necun poter terren capace de jammais facer que illo sia un facto.

column2: Give this to Tom when he comes in.
column4: Da isto al Tom quando ille arrivara.

column2: Give me some of those.
column4: Da me alicunos de illos.

column2: Explain it to me.
column4: Explica me isto.

column2: Every time I think of Tom, I get a lump in my throat.
column4: Cata vice que io pensa a Tom, io habe un nodo in mi gorga.

column2: Don't you trust me?
column4: Vos non confide in me?

column2: Do you suppose we can get together some evening?
column4: Pensa vos que nos potera incontrar nos alicun proxime vespere?

column2: Do you like the theater?
column4: Ama vos le theatro?

column2: Do you know this man?
column4: Cognosce vos iste homine?

column2: Do you know this man?
column4: Esque vos cognosce iste viro?

column2: Do you know their address?
column4: Sape vos lor adresse?

column2: Do you have title to that property?
column4: Ha vos le titulo de proprietate de iste immobile?

column2: Do you have something better than this?
column4: Ha vos alique melior que isto?

column2: Did you try this key?
column4: Ha vos essayate iste clave?

column2: Did they really do all that work by themselves?
column4: Esque illes ha realmente facite tote iste travalio sol?

column2: Come here this minute.
column4: Veni ci in iste minuta.

column2: Can't you work any faster than that?
column4: Esque tu non pote laborar un pauc plus rapidemente?

column2: Can you get there by car?
column4: Esque on pote ir usque ibi in auto?

column2: Can we find anybody that knows this town?
column4: Esque nos potera trovar alicuno qui cognosce iste urbe?

column2: Buy some toys.
column4: Compra alicun joculos.

column2: As long as we've driven this far, we might as well go on.
column4: In tanto que nos ha conducite usque ci, nos ben poterea continuar.

column2: Are you through with this book?
column4: Esque vos ha finite de leger iste libro?

column2: Are you telling me the truth?
column4: Esque vos me dice le veritate?

column2: Are you a friend of theirs?
column4: Es vos lor amico?

column2: Are they the people you told me about?
column4: Es illes le personas de qui vos me ha parlate?

column2: Are these bags yours?
column4: Esque iste saccos es vostre?

column2: Are there any vacancies at your hotel?
column4: Esque in tu hotel il ha cameras non occupate?

column2: Are their wives permitted to see them?
column4: Esque lor sposas ha le permission de vider les?

column2: Apply this cream to your face.
column4: Applica iste crema super vostre facie.

column2: Am I too late?
column4: Es io multo in retardo?

column2: Would you like some more bread?
column4: Vole vos plus de pan?

column2: First love is a kind of vaccination which saves a man from catching the complaint the second time.
column4: Le prime amor es un sorta de vaccination que libera un homine de attrappar le maladia le secunde vice.

column2: Excuse me, which way is the station?
column4: Excusa me, qual es le direction del station?

column2: Wait. I can't walk that fast.
column4: Attende. Io non pote ambular con tante rapiditate.

column2: Excuse me, where is the taxi stand?
column4: Pardona me, ubi es le station de taxis?

column2: Love is a game in which one always cheats.
column4: Le amor es un joco in que sempre uno frauda.

column2: Love is the poetry of the senses.
column4: Le amor es le poesia del sensos.

column2: Modesty is the conscience of the body.
column4: Le pudor es le conscientia del corpore.

column2: The more one judges, the less one loves.
column4: Quanto plus uno judica, tanto minus uno ama.

column2: The smallest flower is a thought, a life answering to some feature of the Great Whole, of whom they have a persistent intuition.
column4: Le flor le plus parve es un pensamento, un vita correspondente a alicun aspecto del Grande Toto, de qui illo habe un intuition persistente.

column2: There is no such thing as a great talent without great will power.
column4: Un grande talento sin grande fortia de voluntate es alique que non existe.

column2: The cats seem very happy.
column4: Le cattos sembla multo satisfacte.

column2: Today has been a good day.
column4: Hodie ha essite un bon jorno.

column2: He doesn't like to speak in public.
column4: Il non le place parlar in publico.

column2: Can you see him moving?
column4: Pote vos vider le movente se?

column2: Can you see her moving?
column4: Pote vos vider la movente se?

column2: You are absolutely right.
column4: Vos es absolutemente correcte.

column2: You are absolutely right.
column4: Vos ha tote le ration del mundo.

column2: The train's about to leave. Hurry up.
column4: Le traino es preste a partir. Hasta te.

column2: This is not a threat.
column4: Isto non es un menacia.

column2: Why does this matter?
column4: Proque es isto importante?

column2: If you drive carefully you'll avoid accidents.
column4: Si tu conducera accuratemente, tu evitara accidentes.

column2: He caught a mouse.
column4: Ille ha attrappate un mure.

column2: If all else fails, read the instructions.
column4: Si qualcunque altere cosa falle, lege le instructiones.

column2: Solitude is fine, but you need someone to tell you that solitude is fine.
column4: Le solitude es agradabile, ma nos ha besonio de alicuno qui nos dice que le solitude es agradabile.

column2: Study lends a kind of enchantment to all our surroundings.
column4: Le studio presta un sorta de incantamento a tote le ambiente que circumfere nos.

column2: The duration of passion is proportionate with the original resistance of the woman.
column4: Le duration del passion es proportionate al resistentia original del femina.

column2: There is something great and terrible about suicide.
column4: Il ha alique de grandiose e terribile con relation al suicidio.

column2: Those who spend too fast never grow rich.
column4: Illes qui disbursa troppo rapidemente nunquam devenira ric.

column2: Virtue, perhaps, is nothing more than politeness of soul.
column4: Forsan le virtute es nihil plus que le politessa del anima.

column2: What is a child, monsieur, but the image of two beings, the fruit of two sentiments spontaneously blended?
column4: Que es un infante, car senior, si non le imagine de duo esseres, le fructo de duo sentimentos spontaneemente miscite?

column2: What is art? Nature concentrated.
column4: Que es arte? Natura concentrate.

column2: When women love us, they forgive us everything, even our crimes; when they do not love us, they give us credit for nothing, not even our virtues.
column4: Quando le feminas ama nos, illas pardona nos toto, mesmo nostre crimines; quando illas non ama nos, illas da nos credito pro nihil, non mesmo nostre virtutes.

column2: Wisdom is the understanding of celestial things to which the Spirit is brought by Love.
column4: Le sagessa es le comprehension de questiones celestial al quales le Spirito es ducite per le Amor.

column2: We haven't had much snow this winter.
column4: Nos non ha habite multe nive in iste hiberno.

column2: This should be more than enough.
column4: Isto debe esser plus que sufficiente.

column2: Clouds signify the veil of the Most High.
column4: Le nubes significa le velo del Altissimo.

column2: Remorse is impotence, impotence which sins again. Repentance alone is powerful; it ends all.
column4: Remorso es impotentia, impotentia que pecca de novo. Solmente le repententia es efficace; illo fini toto.

column2: The most real of all splendors are not in outward things, they are within us.
column4: De tote le splendores le plus authentic non se trova externemente, ma intra nos.

column2: Physically, a man is a man for a much longer time than a woman is a woman.
column4: Physicamente, un homine es un homine durante multo tempore plus que un femina es un femina.

column2: Temptations can be got rid of. How? By yielding to them.
column4: Il es possibile liberar nos del tentationes. Como? Per ceder a illos.

column2: The general title (of Balzac's novels) is The Human Comedy.
column4: Le titulo general (del romanes de Balzac) es Le Comedia Human.

column2: A woman must be a genius to create a good husband.
column4: Un femina debe esser un genio pro crear un bon marito.

column2: I prefer thought to action, an idea to an event, reflection to activity.
column4: Io prefere le pensamento al action, un idea a un evento, le reflexion al activitate.

column2: Men are so made that they can resist sound argument, and yet yield to a glance.
column4: Le viros es facite de un materia que les permitte resister al argumento le plus judiciose, e, totevia, les face render se a un reguardo.

column2: Today it is cold.
column4: Il face frigido hodie.

column2: To cause laughter without joining in greatly heightens the effect.
column4: Provocar le riso sin adjunger se a illo augmenta considerabilemente le effecto.

column2: You swim very quickly.
column4: Vos nata multo celeremente.

column2: You swim very quickly.
column4: Vos nata como un pisce.

column2: I'm afraid I have some bad news.
column4: Io regretta dicer que io ha mal novas.

column2: I'm afraid I have some rather bad news.
column4: Io regretta dicer que io ha novas satis mal.

column2: No woman dares to refuse love without a motive, for nothing is more natural than to yield to love.
column4: Sin un motivo, necun femina osa refusar le amor, nam nihil es plus natural que render se al amor.

column2: God is the author, men are only the players. These grand pieces which are played upon earth have been composed in heaven.
column4: Deo es le autor, le homines es solmente le musicos. Iste pecias meraviliose toccate ci super le terra ha essite componite in le celo.

column2: A woman filled with faith in the one she loves is the creation of a novelist's imagination.
column4: Un femina qui confida integremente in le homine qui illa ama es le creation del imagination de alicun novellista.

column2: A great love is a credit opened in favor of a power so consuming that the moment of bankruptcy must inevitably occur.
column4: Un grande amor es un credito aperte in favor de un potentia si exhauriente que le momento del fallimento debe inevitabilemente occurrer.

column2: Misfortune makes of certain souls a vast desert through which rings the voice of God.
column4: Le infortuna face de qualque animas un vaste deserto a transverso del qual resona le voce de Deo.

column2: Poetry is only born after painful journeys into the vast regions of thought.
column4: Le poesia solmente nasce post penose jornatas a in le vaste regiones del pensamento.

column2: You cannot pluck love out of your heart as you would pull a tooth.
column4: Uno non pote eveller del corde le amor como uno extraherea un dente.

column2: At fifteen, neither beauty nor talent exist: a woman is all promise.
column4: A dece-cinque annos, ni beltate ni talento existe: le femina es toto un promissa.

column2: God is the poet; men are but the actors. The great dramas of earth were written in heaven.
column4: Deo es le poeta; le homines non es plus que actores. Le grande dramas in le terra ha essite scripte in le celo.

column2: Do you not see with your own eyes the chrysalis fact assume by degrees the wings of fiction?
column4: Non vide vos con vostre oculos mesme que le facto chrysalide gradualmente disveloppa le alas del fiction?

column2: It's very likely going to be dangerous.
column4: Probabilemente il essera multo periculose.

column2: It's very likely going to be dangerous.
column4: Multo probabilemente il essera periculose.

column2: After your death you will be what you were before your birth.
column4: Post vostre morte vos essera lo que vos esseva ante vostre nascentia.

column2: A man can be himself only so long as he is alone.
column4: Un homine solmente pote esser ille mesme durante que ille es sol.

column2: Reading is equivalent to thinking with someone else's head instead of with one's own.
column4: Leger equivale a pensar con le testa de un altere persona in vice de con su proprie testa.

column2: Every parting gives a foretaste of death, every reunion a hint of the resurrection.
column4: Cata separation anticipa nos alique del experientia del morte, cata nove incontro face nos prelibar alique del resurrection.

column2: Great men are like eagles, and build their nest on some lofty solitude.
column4: Le homines eminente es como le aquilas, que construe lor nidos super locales elevate e solitari.

column2: Religion is the masterpiece of the art of animal training, for it trains people as to how they shall think.
column4: Le religion es le obra magistral del arte del trainamento animal, nam illo traina le homines quanto al modo como illes debera pensar.

column2: The alchemists in their search for gold discovered many other things of greater value.
column4: Cercante le auro, le alchimistas discoperiva multe altere cosas de plus grande valor.

column2: The doctor sees all the weakness of mankind; the lawyer all the wickedness, the theologian all the stupidity.
column4: Le medico percipe tote le debilitate del esser human; le advocato tote le malitia, le theologo tote le stupiditate.

column2: The more unintelligent a man is, the less mysterious existence seems to him.
column4: Quanto plus destituite de intelligentia es un homine, tanto minus mysteriose le pare le existentia.

column2: The wise have always said the same things, and fools, who are the majority, have always done just the opposite.
column4: Le sagios ha sempre dicite le mesme cosas, e le stultos, qui es le majoritate, ha sempre facite exactemente le contrario.

column2: To buy books would be a good thing if we also could buy the time to read them.
column4: Comprar libros esserea un bon cosa si nos anche poteva comprar le tempore pro leger los.

column2: The worst blind man is the one who does not want to see.
column4: Le pejor ceco es ille qui non vole vider.

column2: International Women's Day (March 8th 2014) celebrates important achievements of women all over the world.
column4: Le Jorno International del Feminas (le 8 de martio 2014) celebra importante realisationes del feminas in tote le mundo.

column2: It is difficult to walk in the sand.
column4: Il es difficile vader in le arena.

column2: It is difficult to walk in the sand.
column4: Vader in le arena es difficile.

column2: In vain have I tried to convince him.
column4: In van io ha tentate convincer le.

column2: It is a great privilege to be with you in Tatoeba.
column4: Il es un grande privilegio esser inter vos in Tatoeba.

column2: She is afraid of being alone with the patient.
column4: Illa time esser sol con le patiente.

column2: She thinks that she can sing.
column4: Illa crede que illa pote cantar.

column2: She made me sell the dog.
column4: Illa me faceva vender le can.

column2: She had the dog sold.
column4: Illa faceva vender le can.

column2: I saw the children kill the bird.
column4: Io videva le infantes occider le ave.

column2: I saw them kill it.
column4: Io les videva occider lo.

column2: I saw it being killed.
column4: Io videva occider lo.

column2: This is a pear.
column4: Isto es un pira.

column2: Don't smoke!
column4: Non fumar!

column2: Don't spit on the floor!
column4: Non sputar super le solo!

column2: Keep to the right!
column4: Tener se al dextra!

column2: It is difficult to decide where to go.
column4: Il es difficile decider se ubi vader.

column2: What are we to believe now?
column4: Que creder nunc?

column2: We did not know what fish to catch first.
column4: Nos non sapeva qual pisce prender primo.

column2: To live alone is the fate of all great souls.
column4: Viver sol es le destino de tote le grande animas.

column2: Treat a work of art like a prince. Let it speak to you first.
column4: Tracta un obra de arte como tu tractarea un prince. Lassa que illo te parla primo.

column2: Religion is the metaphysics of the common people.
column4: Le religion es le metaphysica del homine commun.

column2: Men need some kind of external activity, because they are inactive within.
column4: Le homines ha besonio de alicun sorta de activitate externe, proque internemente illes es inactive.

column2: There is one respect in which brutes show real wisdom when compared with us — I mean their quiet, placid enjoyment of the present moment.
column4: Il ha un puncto particular in le qual le animales monstra ver sagessa quando comparate con nos — io vole dicer lor maniera quiete e placide de gauder del momento presente.

column2: Welcome to our 1st German class.
column4: Benvenite a nostre prime lection de germano.

column2: The present is the only reality and the only certainty.
column4: Le presente es le unic realitate e le unic certitude.

column2: There is not a grain of dust, not an atom that can become nothing, yet man believes that death is the annihilation of his being.
column4: Il non existe un grano de arena, non mesmo un atomo que pote devenir nihil, totevia le homine crede que le morte es le annihilation de su esser.

column2: This is our first lesson.
column4: Iste es nostre prime lection.

column2: No one can transcend their own individuality.
column4: Nemo pote transcender su proprie individualitate.

column2: Yes, we have two children.
column4: Si, nos ha duo infantes.

column2: I promise to be an excellent husband, but give me a wife who, like the moon, will not appear every day in my sky.
column4: Io promitte esser un marito excellente, ma da me un sposa qui, como le luna, non va apparer me tote le dies in le celo.

column2: This water can be drunk without risk.
column4: Iste aqua pote esser bibite sin risco.

column2: My cellphone has been stolen.
column4: Mi telephono mobile ha essite furate.

column2: I can't find my umbrella!
column4: Io non succede a trovar mi parapluvia!

column2: There are so many languages in the world but there is not any word that can express how much I love you.
column4: Il ha tante idiomas in le mundo, ma il non ha ulle parola que pote exprimer quanto io te ama.

column2: The Eagle has landed.
column4: Le Aquila ha atterrate.

column2: This is one small step for a man, one giant leap for mankind.
column4: Pro un homine isto es un parve passo, ma pro le humanitate illo es un salto gigantesc.

column2: Geologists have a saying — rocks remember.
column4: Le geologistas ha un dicto — le roccas se rememora.

column2: Geologists have a saying — rocks remember.
column4: Le geologos ha un dicto — le roccas habe memoria.

column2: Gliders, sail planes, they're wonderful flying machines. It's the closest you can come to being a bird.
column4: Le planatores, aeroplanos sin motor, es meraviliose machinas volante. Il es le plus proxime que on pote arrivar a esser un ave.

column2: Here men from the planet Earth first set foot upon the Moon. July 1969 AD. We came in peace for all mankind.
column4: Hic homines ab le planeta Terra primo poneva lor pedes super le Luna. Julio 1969 AD. Nos ha venite in pace pro tote le humanitate.

column2: I believe every human has a finite number of heartbeats. I don't intend to waste any of mine.
column4: Io crede que tote homine habe un numero finite de battimentos del corde. Io non ha le intention de guastar ulle del mies.

column2: The boy has four rabbits, two male and two female ones.
column4: Le puero ha quatro conilios, duo mascules e duo feminines.

column2: I was elated, ecstatic and extremely surprised that we were successful.
column4: Io esseva incantate, ecstasiate e extrememente surprendite que nos esseva successose.

column2: Mystery creates wonder and wonder is the basis of man's desire to understand.
column4: Le mysterio genera admiration e le admiration es le base del desiro de cognoscer del homine.

column2: There can be no great accomplishment without risk.
column4: Il non pote exister ulle grande realisation sin risco.

column2: Other life probably exists out there and perhaps in many places.
column4: Altere formas de vita probabilemente existe foras del Terra e forsan in multe locos.

column2: No one is born hating another person because of the colour of his skin, or his background, or his religion. People must learn to hate, and if they can learn to hate, they can be taught to love, for love comes more naturally to the human heart than its opposite.

Le personas, pro poter odiar, debe esser inseniate, e, si illes pote apprender a odiar, illes anche pote esser inseniate a amar, nam al corde del homine le amor arriva plus facilemente que su opposite.

column2: Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.

column2: All are lunatics, but he who can analyze his delusions is called a philosopher.

column2: Patience is a minor form of despair, disguised as a virtue.

column2: Woman would be more charming if one could fall into her arms without falling into her hands.

column2: Responsibility is a detachable burden that can easily be shifted to the shoulders of God, Fate, Fortune, Luck or one's neighbor. In the days of astrology it was customary to unload it upon a star.
column4: Responsabilitate es un carga distachabile que pote facilemente esser transferite al humeros de Deo, le Fato, le Fortuna, le Sorte o un vicino nostre. In le dies del astrologia on soleva discargar lo super un stella.

column2: In each human heart are a tiger, a pig, an ass and a nightingale. Diversity of character is due to their unequal activity.
column4: In cata corde human il ha un tigre, un porco, un asino e un rossiniolo. Le diversitate de character es debite a lor activitate inequal.

column2: Love is a temporary insanity curable by marriage or by removal of the patient from the influences under which he incurred the disorder.
column4: Le amor es un insanitate temporari curabile per le maritage o per remotion del patiente ab le influentias sub le quales ille contraheva le maladia.

column2: A man is known by the company he organizes.

column2: To abscond means to move in a mysterious way, commonly with the property of another.
column4: Fugir significa mover se de maniera mysteriose, usualmente portante le proprietate de un altero.

column2: Absence blots people out. We really have no absent friends.
column4: Le absentia occulta le personas. In veritate nos non ha amicos absente.

column2: An absurdity is a statement or belief manifestly inconsistent with one's own opinion.
column4: Un absurdo es un enunciation o un credentia manifestemente contrari a nostre proprie opinion.

column2: Admiration is our polite recognition of another's resemblance to ourselves.
column4: Admiration es nostre polite recognoscentia del similitude inter alicuno e nos mesme.

column2: Beauty is the power by which a woman charms a lover and terrifies a husband.
column4: Le beltate da a un femina le poter de incantar un amante e terrificar un marito.

column2: A coward is someone who, in a perilous emergency, thinks with his legs.
column4: Un coardo es alicuno qui, in un situation periculose, pensa con su gambas.

column2: A bore is a person who talks when you wish him to listen.
column4: Un typo enoiose sempre parla quando tu vole que ille audi.

column2: A clairvoyant is a person, commonly a woman, who has the power of seeing that which is invisible to her patron — namely, that he is a blockhead.
column4: Un clarividente es un persona, usualmente un femina, qui ha le capacitate de vider lo que, pro su cliente, il es impossibile de discerner, a saper, que ille es stupide.

column2: A convent is a place of retirement for women who wish for leisure to meditate upon the sin of idleness.
column4: Un convento es un loco retirate pro feminas qui cerca otio pro meditar super le peccato del otiositate.

column2: Death is not the end. There remains the litigation over the estate.

column4: Edibile significa bon pro eder e facile a digerer, como un verme pro un bufon, un bufon pro un cobra, un cobra pro un porco, un porco pro un homine, e un homine pro un verme.

column2: Experience is a revelation in the light of which we renounce our errors of youth for those of age.
column4: Experientia es un revelation, al luce del qual nos renuncia a nostre errores del juventute in favor de illos del etate.

column2: A fork is an instrument used chiefly for the purpose of putting dead animals into the mouth.

column2: An interpreter is one who enables two persons of different languages to understand each other by repeating to each what it would have been to the interpreter's advantage for the other to have said.
column4: Un interprete es uno qui face possibile le communication inter duo personas parlante linguas differente, per repeter a cata un de illes lo que pro ille il esserea plus facile a traducer si le altere persona lo habeva dicite.

column2: Inhumanity is one of the signal and characteristic qualities of humanity.

column2: Painting is the art of protecting flat surfaces from the weather, and exposing them to the critic.

column2: The covers of this book are too far apart.

column2: The small part of ignorance that we arrange and classify we give the name of knowledge.

column4: Mi transition ab viro a femina va ben.
