column4: Mi transition ab viro a femina i ben.

column2: I am transitioning well from a man to a woman.
column4: Io transi ben ab viro a femina.

column2: Men lick their lips when they look at her.
column4: Le viros lecca su labios quando illes la reguarda.

column2: You can hear the sound of the ocean.
column4: Il es possibile ascoltar le sono del mar.

column2: The cosmos is all that ever was, that ever is and that ever will be.
column4: Le cosmo es toto lo que sempre ha essite, lo que sempre es e lo que sempre essera.

column2: Give me a sandwich with sauerkraut, said Cicero.
column4: Da me un sandwich con sauerkraut, diceva Cicero.

column2: I thought something was strange.
column4: Il me semblava que alique esseva estranie.

column2: I worship the goddess Astarte.
column4: Io adora le dea Astarte.

column2: The joke fell flat.
column4: Nemo comprendeva le burla.

column2: Where is the center of the universe?
column4: Ubi es le centro del universo?

column2: It doesn't get any better than this.
column4: Isto es le melior que on pote arrangiar.

column2: Language is the dress of thought.
column4: Le lingua es le habito del pensamento.

column2: You knew I was married.
column4: Tu sapeva que io es maritate.

column2: She is always polite!
column4: Illa es semper polite!

column2: Don't buy it!
column4: Non compra lo!

column2: Do you feel like going skiing?
column4: Esque tu vole ir a skiar?

column2: I am really fed up with winter.
column4: Io es vermente satiate de hiberno.

column2: She agrees with me.
column4: Illa es de accordo con me.

column2: I am very happy to see you.
column4: Io es multo contente de vider te.

column2: I think God is a woman.
column4: Io pensa que Deo es un femina.

column2: He's a health nut.
column4: Ille se concerne troppo con su sanitate.

column2: It's not for everybody.
column4: Illo non es pro totes.

column2: Many factors must be considered.
column4: On debe considerar multe factores.

column2: We bought bread and milk.
column4: Nos ha comprate pan e lacte.

column2: I love to be in nature.
column4: Io es un amante del natura.

column2: At one time I knew chemistry as well as I knew mathematics.
column4: Durante un certe tempore io sapeva equalmente e chimia e mathematica.

column2: Could it be worse ?
column4: Esque il poterea esser pejor?

column2: For some people, "God" is themselves.
column4: Pro alicun personas, "Deo" es illes mesme.

column2: I am enamored by you.
column4: Io es inamorate de vos.

column2: I am enamored by you.
column4: Io es inamorate de te.

column2: What is the difference?
column4: Que es le differentia?

column2: I like the blue.
column4: Io ama le blau.

column2: Esperanto spread around the world without bloodshed. What other world language can make the same boast?
column4: Le esperanto se ha diffundite in tote le mundo sin effusion de sanguine. Qual altere lingua in le planeta se pote gloriar de un simile interprisa?

column2: Using words, one can fight precisely.
column4: Per le uso del parolas on pote combatter con efficientia.

column2: In 1969 I gave up women and alcohol — it was the worst 20 minutes of my life.
column4: In 1969 io renunciava al feminas e al alcohol — il ha essite le pejor 20 minutas de mi vita.

column2: Fasten your seatbelts.
column4: Attacha vostre cincturas de securitate.

column2: Don't be so choosy.
column4: Non sia tanto exigente.

column2: What hype!
column4: Qual duperia!

column2: If you wish to make an apple pie from scratch, you must first invent the universe.
column4: Si uno vole facer un torta al pomos comenciante de zero, uno debe antea inventar le universo.

column2: We are a way for the cosmos to know itself.
column4: Nos es un modo que le cosmo ha pro cognoscer se.

column2: We are like butterflies who flutter for a day and think it's forever.
column4: Nos es como papiliones que voletta durante un jorno e pensa que il es pro sempre.

column2: Matter is composed chiefly of nothing.
column4: Le materia es constituite principalmente de nihil.

column2: You can't convince a believer of anything; for their belief is not based on evidence, it's based on a deep-seated need to believe.
column4: Uno non pote convincer un credente de ulle cosa, pois que su credentia non es basate super evidentias, ma super un intime necessitate de creder.

column2: Store in a cool and dry place.
column4: Conserva in loco fresc e sec.

column2: Cut the cloth on the bias.
column4: Talia le drappo in diagonal.

column2: He has started writing the dictionary in his native language.
column4: Ille ha comenciato a scriber le dictionario in su lingua materne.

column2: The original is unfaithful to the translation.
column4: Le original es infidel al traduction.

column2: Translation is at best an echo.
column4: Le traduction pote esser in le melior caso un echo.

column2: Translation is the art of failure.
column4: Le traduction es le arte del insuccesso.

column2: Where words can be translated into equivalent words, the style of an original can be closely followed; but no translation which aims at being written in normal English can reproduce the style of Aristotle.
column4: Ubi le parolas pote esser traducite a in parolas equivalente, le stilo de un original pote esser sequite proximemente; sed necun traduction que vole esser scripte in anglese normal pote reproducer le stilo de Aristotele.

column2: As far as modern writing is concerned, it is rarely rewarding to translate it, although it might be easy. Translation is very much like copying paintings.
column4: Con respecto al litteratura moderne, il rarmente vale le pena traducer lo, ben que illo pote esser facile. Traducer es multo simile a copiar picturas.

column2: The best thing on translation was said by Cervantes: translation is the other side of a tapestry.
column4: Le melior cosa super traduction lo ha dicite Cervantes: traduction es le reverso de un tapisseria.

column2: A translation is no translation, unless it will give you the music of a poem along with the words of it.
column4: Un traduction non es traduction, a minus que illo nos da e le parolas e le musica del poema.

column2: No other language is as beautiful as Portuguese.
column4: Necun altere lingua es si belle como le portugese.

column2: Translation is like a woman. If it is beautiful, it is not faithful. If it is faithful, it is most certainly not beautiful.
column4: Le traduction es como un femina. Si illo es belle, non es fidel. Si es fidel, illo certemente non es belle.

column2: Poetry is what is lost in translation. It is also what is lost in interpretation.
column4: Le poesia es lo que on perde in traduction. Illo es anque lo que es perdite in interpretation.

column2: If the situation doesn't improve, I'll be obliged to take measures.
column4: Si le situation non cambia pro le melior, io essera obligate a prender precautiones.

column2: Tom assumed Mary was talking nonsense simply because he didn't understand her.
column4: Tom supponeva que Maria parlava nonsenso simplemente proque ille non la comprendeva.

column2: You love yourself.
column4: Tu te ama.

column2: You are a magical being who radiates with light.
column4: Tu es un esser magic qui radia con lumine.

column2: You are a child of the same cosmos that created Plato, Buddha and Confucius.
column4: Tu es un infante del mesme cosmos que creava Plato, Buddha e Confucio.

column2: You don't have to be a victim.
column4: Tu non debe esser un victima.

column2: You have the power of choice in your affairs.
column4: Tu ha le poter de selection in tu affaires.

column2: You are fabulous.
column4: Tu es fabulose.

column2: You are sparkling.
column4: Tu scintilla.

column2: You're glowing.
column4: Tu incandesce.

column2: You are enough.
column4: Tu es bastante.

column2: You are complete.
column4: Tu es complete.

column2: You don't have to fight a battle with yourself.
column4: Tu non debe combatter con te mesme.

column2: A good change can never come too late.
column4: Un bon cambiamento non poterea esser troppo tardive.

column2: Who could not love you?
column4: Qui poterea non amar te?

column2: It is good to be yourself. Who else could you be?
column4: Il es bon esser tu mesme. Qui altere poterea tu esser?

column2: When we remember that we are all mad, the mysteries disappear and life stands explained.
column4: Quando nos nos rememora que tote nos son folle, le mysterios dispare e le vita sta explicate.

column2: She talks about everything with her parents.
column4: Illa parla de toto con su parentes.

column2: The translator's task is to create, in his or her own language, the same tensions appearing in the original. That's hard!
column4: Le carga de un traductor es crear in su proprie lingua le mesme tensiones que appare in le original. Isto es difficile!

column2: It is only logical for the translator to become a part of the world of the author.
column4: Il es plus que logic que le traductor deveni un parte del mundo del autor.

column2: Your mother is so fat, when she’s in town, Rome has eight hills.
column4: Tu matre es tanto grasse que quando illa es in urbe, Roma ha octo colles.

column2: No one but me is allowed to do that!
column4: Nemo preter me ha le derecto de facer lo!

column2: The translator constantly learns new things about himself.
column4: Le traductor multo sovente apprende nove cosas super se mesme.

column2: I encourage the translators of my books to take as much license as they feel that they need.
column4: Io incoragia le traductores de mi libros a prender tante licentia quante illes senti que il es necesse.

column2: There must of course be a relationship between translating and making poems of your own, but what it is I just don't know.
column4: Certo il debe exister un relation inter traducer e facer su proprie poemas, sed que es iste relation io simplemente non sape.

column2: Mathematicians are like some Frenchmen: whatever you say to them they translate into their own language, and forthwith it is something entirely different.
column4: Le mathematicos es como alicun franceses: qualcunque cosa que on les dice, illes traduce a in lor lingua materne, e immediatemente illo deveni alique completemente differente.

column2: Our descendants will sooner or later reach, as a race, the condition of cosmic consciousness, just as, long ago, our ancestors passed from simple consciousness into self-consciousness.
column4: Nostre descendentes attingera tosto o tarde, como racia, le condition de conscientia cosmic, justo como, ante multe tempore, nostre ancestres ha passate del simple conscientia a in le conscientia de se mesme.

column2: If you listen to a lot of music, it gradually seeps into your consciousness or your unconsciousness and comes out in your music.
column4: Quando tu ascolta multe musica, illo gradualmente se instilla in tu conscientia o in tu mente inconsciente, e postea illo sorti como tu proprie musica.

column2: The greatest barrier to consciousness is the belief that one is already conscious.
column4: Le plus grande barriera al conscientia es le credentia que uno es jam consciente.

column2: I regard consciousness as fundamental. I regard matter as derivative from consciousness. We cannot get behind consciousness. Everything that we talk about, everything that we regard as existing, postulates consciousness.
column4: Io considera como fundamental le conscientia. Io vide le materia como un derivativo del conscientia. Nos non pote poner de latere le conscientia. Cata objecto de nostre conversationes, toto que nos considera como existente, exige conscientia.

column2: You are an original masterpiece.
column4: Tu es un obra original de maestro.

column2: You are incomparable.
column4: Tu es incomparabile.

column2: Everything in the Universe, throughout all its kingdoms, is conscious, i.e., endowed with a consciousness of its own kind and on its own plane of perception.
column4: Cata cosa in le universo, per tote su regnos, es consciente, i.e., dotate de conscientia conforme su proprie specie e super le plan de su proprie perception.

column2: Pure mathematics is religion.
column4: Mathematica pur es religion.

column2: Pure mathematics is, in its way, the poetry of logical ideas.
column4: Le mathematica pur es, a su maniera, le poesia del ideas logic.

column2: In mathematics the art of proposing a question must be held of higher value than solving it.
column4: In mathematica, enunciar clar- e precisemente un problema debe esser plus importante que solver lo.

column2: Mathematics is as old as Man.
column4: Le mathematica es tanto ancian como le Homine.

column2: Mathematics is the most beautiful and most powerful creation of the human spirit.
column4: Le mathematica es le plus belle e plus potente creation del spirito human.

column2: Obvious is the most dangerous word in mathematics.
column4: Obvie es le plus periculose parola in mathematica.

column2: Film is one of the three universal languages, the other two: mathematics and music.
column4: Le cinematographia es un del tres linguages universal, le altere duo: le mathematica e le musica.

column2: How can it be that mathematics, being after all a product of human thought independent of experience, is so admirably adapted to the objects of reality?
column4: Como es il possibile que le mathematica, essente post toto un producto del pensamento human independente del experientia, se adapta de maniera si admirabile al objectos del realitate?

column2: I just became president of Poets Without Homes.
column4: Io justo deveniva presidente de Poetas sin domos.

column2: Even when I was studying mathematics, physics, and computer science, it always seemed that the problem of consciousness was about the most interesting problem out there for science to come to grips with.
column4: Mesmo quando io studiava mathematica, physica e informatica, il me ha sempre parite que le problema del conscientia es possibilemente le plus interessante inter illos que le scientia debe solver.

column2: Mathematics is written for mathematicians.
column4: Le mathematica es scribite pro mathematicos.

column2: God used beautiful mathematics in creating the world.
column4: Deo ha usate belle mathematica in crear le mundo.

column2: If I were again beginning my studies, I would follow Plato's advice and start with mathematics.
column4: Si io poteva de nove initiar mi studios, io sequerea le aviso de Platon e io comenciarea per le mathematica.

column2: The abstract analysis of the world by mathematics and physics rests on the concepts of space and time.
column4: Le analyse abstracte del mundo per le mathematica e le physica es basate super le conceptos de spatio e tempore.

column2: Mathematics knows no races or geographic boundaries; for mathematics, the cultural world is one country.
column4: Le mathematica non cognosce racias o frontieras geographic; pro le mathematica, le mundo cultural es un sol.

column2: Poetry is a form of mathematics, a highly rigorous relationship with words.
column4: Le poesia es un forma de mathematica, un relation extrememente rigorose con le parolas.

column2: Music at times is more like perfume than mathematics.
column4: Le musica, a vices, simila plus perfumo que mathematica.

column2: Logic and mathematics are nothing but specialised linguistic structures.
column4: Logica e mathematica es nihil plus que structuras linguistic specialisate.

column2: How is an error possible in mathematics?
column4: Como es possibile un error in mathematica?

column2: Mathematics is the music of reason.
column4: Le mathematica es le musica del ration.

column2: May not music be described as the mathematics of the sense, mathematics as music of the reason? The musician feels mathematics, the mathematician thinks music: music the dream, mathematics the working life.
column4: Esque le musica non pote esser definite como le mathematica del sensos, e le mathematica como le musica del ration? Le musico senti mathematica, le mathematico pensa musica: musica le sonio, mathematica le vita practic.

column2: There's something uniquely interesting about Buddhism and mathematics, particularly about quantum physics, and where they meet. That has fascinated us for a long time.
column4: Il ha alique singularmente interessante concernente le buddhismo e le mathematica, specialmente super le physica quantic, e le punctos que illos ha in commun. Isto nos ha fascinate durante longe tempore.

column2: Pythagorean thought was dominated by mathematics, but it was also profoundly mystical.
column4: Le pensamento pythagoric esseva dominate per le mathematica, sed illo esseva etiam profundemente mystic.

column2: As far as the laws of mathematics refer to reality, they are not certain; and as far as they are certain, they do not refer to reality.
column4: Quanto le leges del mathematica concerne le realitate, illos non es certe; e quanto illos es certe, illos non concerne le realitate.

column2: Equations are just the boring part of mathematics. I attempt to see things in terms of geometry.
column4: Le equationes es justo le parte enoiose del mathematica. Io essaya de vider le cosas in terminos de geometiria.

column2: Mathematics is the foundation of all exact knowledge of natural phenomena.
column4: Le mathematica es le fundamento de omne cognoscimento exacte del phenomenos natural.

column2: Being a language, mathematics may be used not only to inform but also, among other things, to seduce.
column4: Essente un linguage, le mathematica pote esser utilisate non solmente pro informar sed etiam, inter altere cosas, pro seducer.

column2: Mathematics would certainly not have come into existence if one had known from the beginning that there was in nature no exactly straight line, no actual circle, no absolute magnitude.
column4: Le mathematica certo non existerea si desde le principio on sapeva que in le natura il non ha linea exactemente recte, circulo perfecte o magnitude absolute.

column2: The rules of logic are to mathematics what those of structure are to architecture.
column4: Le regulas del logica es pro la mathematica lo que los del structura es pro le architectura.

column2: Mathematics is the queen of the sciences.
column4: Le mathematica es le regina del scientias.

column2: Go down deep enough into anything and you will find mathematics.
column4: Si nos descendeva troppo profundemente in le structura de qualcunque cosa, nos trovarea mathematica sol.

column2: Mathematics is the only good metaphysics.
column4: Le mathematica es le unic metaphysica bon.

column2: There are no creeds in mathematics.
column4: Il non ha credos in mathematica.

column2: Mathematics has not a foot to stand upon which is not purely metaphysical.
column4: Le mathematica non ha ulle puncto de base que non sia purmente metaphysic.

column2: The infinite! No other question has ever moved so profoundly the spirit of man.
column4: Le infinito! Necun altere question ha jammais movite tanto profundemente le spirito del homine.

column2: Thought is a function of our consciusness, an ability that we as humans have. We are the producers of our own thinking.
column4: Le pensamento es un function de nostre conscientia, un capacitate que nos, como esseres human, habe. Nos es le productores de nostre proprie pensamento.

column2: All science is experiential; but all experience must be related back to and derives its validity from the conditions and context of consciousness in which it arises, i.e. the totality of our nature.
column4: Omne scientia es basate super le experientia; sed le validitate del resultatos obtenite per cata experimento es inseparabilemente unite al conditiones e al contexto de conscientia in que le prova es realisate, vale dicer, le totalitate de nostre natura.

column2: A book, like a landscape, is a state of consciousness varying with readers.
column4: Un libro, como un paisage, es un stato de conscientia que varia con le lectores.

column2: Life is a state of consciousness.
column4: Le vita es un stato de conscientia.

column2: Life is a series of sensations connected to different states of consciousness.
column4: Le vita es un serie de sensationes connectite a differente statos de conscientia.

column2: Each of us can manifest the properties of a field of consciousness that transcends space, time and linear causality.
column4: Cata uno de nos pote manifestar le proprietates de un campo de conscientia que transcende spatio, tempore e causalitate linear.

column2: The new formula in physics describes humans as paradoxical beings who have two complementary aspects. They can show properties of Newtonian objects and also infinite fields of consciousness.
column4: Le nove formula del physica describe le homines como esseres paradoxal qui ha duo aspectos complementari. Illes pote monstrar proprietates newtonian de objectos e etiam campos infinite de conscientia.

column2: There is an urgent need for a radical revision of our current concepts of the nature of consciousness and its relationship to matter and the brain.
column4: Il ha urgente necessitate de un revision radical de nostre actual conceptos super le natura del conscientia e su relation con le materia e le cerebro.

column2: I know that you are part of me and I am part of you because we are all aspects of the same infinite consciousness that we call God and Creation.
column4: Io sape que tu es parte de me e io es parte de te, proque nos totes es aspectos del mesme conscientia infinite que nos appella Deo e Creation.

column2: Consciousness is limitless and the ultimate reality.
column4: Le conscientia es le infinite e supreme realitate.

column2: Time is not an absolute reality but an aspect of our consciousness.
column4: Le tempore non es un realitate absolute, sed un aspecto de nostre conscientia.

column2: God is not a limited individual who sits alone up in the clouds on a golden throne. God is pure Consciousness that dwells within everything. Understanding this truth, learn to accept and love everyone equally.
column4: Deo non es un entitate limitate que se sede sol super un throno de auro in le nubes. Deo es pur Conscientia e es in le interior de toto. Comprendente iste veritate, apprende a acceptar e amar totes equalmente.

column2: Consciousness is a precondition of being.
column4: Conscientia es condition previe de esser.

column2: Vedanta teaches that consciousness is singular, all happenings are played out in one universal consciousness and there is no multiplicity of selves.
column4: Le Vedas insenia que le conscientia es singular, tote le occurrentias se realisa, del principio usque al fin, in un sol conscientia universal, e il non ha multiplicitate de esseres.

column2: True philosophy must start from the most immediate and comprehensive fact of consciousness: I am life that wants to live, in the midst of life that wants to live.
column4: Le ver philosophia debe comenciar ab le realitate le plus immediate e comprehensive del conscientia: Io es vita que vole viver, in medio de vita que vole viver.

column2: Enlightenment is like everyday consciousness but two inches above the ground.
column4: Le illumination es como le conscientia quotidian, sed duo pollices supra le solo.

column2: I believe that consciousness is the way information feels when being processed.
column4: Io crede que conscientia es le sensation que le information experimenta quando illo es processate.

column2: Suffering has a noble purpose: the evolution of the consciousness and the burning up of the ego.
column4: Le suffrentia ha un proposito nobile: le evolution del conscientia e le combustion del ego.

column2: As body, mind or soul, you are a dream; you really are Being, Consciousness, Bliss (satchidananda). You are the God of this universe.
column4: Como corpo, mente o anima, tu es un sonio; tu es, vermente, Esser, Conscientia, Felicitate (satchidananda). Tu es le Deo de iste universo.

column2: Is it true that Tatoeba was bought by Google for 1 billion dollars?
column4: Es il ver que Tatoeba ha essite comprate per Google pro mille milliones de dollares?

column2: You cannot be both unhappy and fully present in the Now.
column4: Uno non pote esser simultaneemente infelice e toto presente in le Nunc.

column2: You cannot find yourself in the past or future. The only place where you can find yourself is in the Now.
column4: Uno non pote trovar se in le passato o futuro. Uno pote esser solmente in le Nunc.

column2: Being must be felt. It can't be thought.
column4: Le esser on debe sentir. Illo non pote esser pensate.

column2: Realize deeply that the present moment is all you ever have.
column4: Comprende profundemente que le momento presente es toto lo que tu sempre ha.

column2: Some cause happiness wherever they go; others whenever they go.
column4: Alcunes causa felicitate a ubicunque illes vade; alteres, quandocunque illes vade.

column2: I can resist anything but temptation.
column4: Io pote resister a toto excepte le tentation.

column2: Life imitates art far more than art imitates life.
column4: Le vita imita le arte multo plus que le arte imita le vita.

column2: One should always be in love. That is the reason one should never marry.
column4: Uno debe esser sempre inamorate. Pro isto uno non debe jammais maritar se.

column2: I like Tom's blue pineapple.
column4: Me place le ananas blau de Tom.

column2: Quantum physics thus reveals a basic oneness of the universe.
column4: Assi, le physica quantic revela un unitate basic del universo.

column2: What we observe as material bodies and forces are nothing but shapes and variations in the structure of space.
column4: Illo que nos observa como corpores material e fortias es nihil plus que formas e variationes in le structura del spatio.

column2: A careful analysis of the process of observation in atomic physics has shown that the subatomic particles have no meaning as isolated entities, but can only be understood as interconnections between the preparation of an experiment and the subsequent measurement.
column4: Un analyse rigorose del processo de observation in le physica atomic ha demonstrate que le particulas subatomic ha nulle signification como entitates isolate, sed pote esser comprendite solmente como connectiones inter le preparation de un experimento e le mensuration subsequente.

column2: Multiplicity is only apparent, in truth, there is only one mind...
column4: Le multiplicitate es solmente apparente, in veritate, il ha un unic mente...

column2: Subject and object are only one. The barrier between them cannot be said to have broken down as a result of recent experience in the physical sciences, for this barrier does not exist.
column4: Subjecto e objecto es solmente un. On non pote dicer que le barriera inter illes ha essite rumpite como resultato de experientias recente in le scientias physic, proque iste barriera non existe.

column2: Thanks for doing what needed to be done.
column4: Gratias pro facer lo que il esseva necesse facer.

column2: If quantum mechanics hasn't profoundly shocked you, you haven't understood it yet.
column4: Si le mechanica quantic non te ha choccate profundemente, tu non lo ha ancora comprendite.

column2: A physicist is just an atom's way of looking at itself.
column4: Un physico es solmente un maniera de un atomo reguardar se mesme.

column2: Every sentence I utter must be understood not as an affirmation, but as a question.
column4: Cata phrase que io dice on debe comprender non como un affirmation, sed como un interrogation.

column2: The opposite of a fact is falsehood, but the opposite of one profound truth may very well be another profound truth.
column4: Le opposito de un facto es falsitate, sed le opposito de un veritate profunde pote multo ben esser un altere veritate profunde.

column2: When it comes to atoms, language can be used only as in poetry. The poet, too, is not nearly so concerned with describing facts as with creating images and establishing mental connections.
column4: Quando il se tracta de atomos, le linguage pote esser usate solmente como in poesia. Le poeta, etiam, non es preoccupate tanto per describer factos quanto per crear images e stabilir connexiones mental.

column2: I am a seagull.
column4: Io es un laro.

column2: Isolated material particles are abstractions, their properties being definable and observable only through their interaction with other systems.
column4: Particulas material isolate es abstractiones; lor proprietates pote esser definite e observate solmente per lor interaction con altere systemas.

column2: A love triangle has at least two blunt angles.
column4: Un triangulo amorose habe al minus duo angulos obtuse.

column2: I'm not religious in the normal sense. I believe the universe is governed by the laws of science. The laws may have been decreed by God, but God does not intervene to break the laws.
column4: Io non es religiose in le senso normal. Io crede que le universo es governate per le leges del scientia. Le leges pote haber essite decretate per Deo, sed Deo non interveni pro infringer le leges.

column2: We are just an advanced breed of monkeys on a minor planet of a very average star. But we can understand the Universe. That makes us something very special.
column4: Nos es solmente un racia de simias avantiate in un planeta minor de un stella vermente median. Sed nos pote comprender le Universo. Isto face que nos deveni alique multo special.

column2: For millions of years, mankind lived just like the animals. Then something happened which unleashed the power of our imagination, we learned to talk.
column4: Durante milliones de annos le homines viveva justo como le animales. Alora alique ha evenite que disfrenava le poter de nostre imagination, nos apprendeva a parlar.

column2: I think it's not gonna be that hard.
column4: Io crede que isto non essera multo difficile.

column2: Babies are bits of star-dust blown from the hand of God. Lucky the woman who knows the pangs of birth, for she has held a star.
column4: Le infantes es granos de pulvere de stellas sufflate ab le mano de Deo. Felice le femina qui cognosce le dolores del parto, post que illa ha possedite un stella.

column2: Talent is God-given; be humble. Fame is man-given; be thankful. Conceit is self-given; be careful.
column4: Le talento es date per Deo; sia humile. Le fama es date per le homine; sia grate. Le vanitate es concipite per uno mesme; presta attention.

column2: Is it hard to be a vegetarian?
column4: Es il difficile esser un vegetariano?

column2: I wonder what that green spot in the distance is.
column4: Io me demanda que es ille macula verde a distantia.

column2: What is God after all? An eternal child playing an eternal game in an eternal garden.
column4: Que es Deo post toto? Un infante eterne jocante un joco eterne in un jardin eterne.

column2: Man know thyself; then thou shalt know the Universe and God.
column4: Homine, cognosce te ipse; alora tu cognoscera le Universo e Deo.

column2: Inhale, and God approaches you. Hold the inhalation, and God remains with you. Exhale, and you approach God. Hold the exhalation, and surrender to God.
column4: Inhala, e Deo approcha te. Sustene le inhalation, e Deo remane con te. Exhala, e tu approcha Deo. Sustene le exhalation, e livra te a Deo.

column2: Because the white genes are mutations of the genes of the original men of color — and males are mutations of the original females — we can finally answer the question Is God black? The answer is Yes, She is.
column4: Post que le genes blanc es mutationes del genes del original homines de color — e le masculos es mutationes del feminas original — nos finalmente pote responder le question Es Deo nigre? Le responsa es Si, Illa es.

column2: There is no Nobel Prize in mathematics.
column4: Il non ha Premio Nobel de mathematica.

column2: I may be as bad as the worst, but, thank God, I am as good as the best.
column4: Io pote esser tanto mal quanto le pejor, sed, gratias a Deo, io es tanto bon quanto le melior.

column2: Love is my true identity. Selflessness is my true self. Love is my true character. Love is my name.
column4: Le amor es mi ver identitate. Le absentia de ego es mi ver esser. Le amor es mi ver character. Amor es mi nomine.

column2: A baby is God's opinion that life should go on.
column4: Un infante es le opinion de Deo de que le vita debe continuar.

column2: But I always think that the best way to know God is to love many things.
column4: Sed io sempre pensa que le melior maniera de cognoscer Deo es amar multe cosas.

column2: To love someone means to see him as God intended him.
column4: Amar alicuno significa viderle como Deo le ha idealisate.

column2: How is it possible that a being with such sensitive jewels as the eyes, such enchanted musical instruments as the ears, and such fabulous arabesque of nerves as the brain can experience itself anything less than a god?
column4: Como es il possibile que un esser con joieles si sensitive como le oculos, instrumentos musical si incantate como le aures, e si fabulose arabesco de nervos como le cerebro pote sentir se minus que un deo?

column2: I can see, and that is why I can be happy, in what you call the dark, but which to me is golden. I can see a God-made world, not a man-made world.
column4: Io pote vider, e iste es le ration pro le qual io pote esser felice, in illo que vos appella tenebras, ma que pro me es aurate. Io pote vider un mundo facite per Deo, non un mundo facite per le homine.

column2: God is everywhere but He is most manifest in man. So serve man as God. That is as good as worshipping God.
column4: Deo es ubique, sed Illo es plus manifeste in le homine. Assi, servi le homine quasi ille es Deo. Isto es tanto bon quanto adorar Deo.

column2: Instead of wishing away nine months of pregnancy and complaining about the shadow over my feet, I'd have cherished every minute of it and realized that the wonderment growing inside me was to be my only chance in life to assist God in a miracle.
column4: In vice de desirar que ille novem menses passara rapidemente, e planger me del umbra super mi pedes, io haberea gaudite de cata minuta del pregnantia, comprendente que le meravilia que cresceva in me es in mi vita le unic opportunitate que io ha pro assister Deo in un miraculo.

column2: If you put more tea-leaves in the teapot, the tea will taste better.
column4: Si tu mitte plus folios de the in le theiera, le the habera un melior gusto.

column2: If God created us in his own image, we have more than reciprocated.
column4: Si Deo nos ha create in su proprie imagine, nos ha multo ben reciprocate.

column2: When did I realize I was God? Well, I was praying and I suddenly realized I was talking to myself.
column4: Quando ha io comprendite que io es Deo? Ben, io alora precava e subito io percipe que io parla con me ipse.

column2: Anyone can count the seeds in an apple, but only God can count the number of apples in a seed.
column4: Qualcuno pote numerar le semines in un pomo, sede solmente Deo pote calcular le numero de pomos in un semine.

column2: You cannot believe in God until you believe in yourself.
column4: Tu non pote creder in Deo usque a que tu crede in te mesme.

column2: I see a clock, but I cannot envision the clockmaker. The human mind is unable to conceive of the four dimensions, so how can it conceive of a God, before whom a thousand years and a thousand dimensions are as one?
column4: Io vide un horologio, ma io non succede a imaginar me le horologiero. Le mente human es incapace de apprehender le quatro dimensiones, assi, como pote illo facer se un idea de un Deo, ante le qual mille annos e mille dimensiones es quasi que un.

column2: The meeting of man and God must always mean a penetration and entry of the divine into the human and a self-immergence of man in the Divinity.
column4: Le incontro del homine con Deo significara sempre un penetration, un entrata, del divin a in le human e un immersion spontanee del homine in le Divinitate.

column2: I could prove God statistically. Take the human body alone — the chances that all the functions of an individual would just happen is a statistical monstrosity.
column4: Io poterea probar statisticamente le existentia de Deo. Considera solmente le corpore human — le probabilitate de tote le functiones de un individuo esser debite al hasardo es un monstruositate statistic.

column2: If I should ever die, God forbid, let this be my epitaph: The only proof he needed for the existence of God was music.
column4: Si io un dia, que Deo non permitte, debera morrer, que mi epitaphio sia iste: Il le ha essite necesse un sol proba del existentia de Deo: le musica.

column2: Mary is addicted to love stories.
column4: Mary es dependente de historias de amor.

column2: The eye with which I see God is the same eye with which God sees me.
column4: Le oculo con que io vide Deo es le mesme oculo con que Deo me vide.

column2: A man is truly free, even here in this embodied state, if he knows that God is the true agent and he by himself is powerless to do anything.
column4: Le homine es vermente libere, mesmo hic in iste stato incarnate, si ille sape que Deo es le ver agente e ille sol es impotente pro facer alicun cosa.

column2: The atheist is God playing at hide and seek with Himself; but is the theist any other? Well, perhaps; for he has seen the shadow of God and clutched at it.
column4: Le atheista es Deo jocante al joco de celamento con Se Mesme; sed, esque le theista es alique differente? Forsan, post que ille ha vidite le umbra de Deo e se impugnava a illo.

column2: Reason in man is rather like God in the world.
column4: Le ration in le homine es quasi Deo in le mundo.

column2: Music is an agreeable harmony for the honor of God and the permissible delights of the soul.
column4: Musica es un harmonia agradabile producite pro le gloria de Deo e le delectos permissibile del anima.

column2: Small amounts of philosophy lead to atheism, but larger amounts bring us back to God.
column4: Parve quantitates de philosophia induce nos al atheismo, ma quantitates major reporta nos a Deo.

column2: The first revolt is against the supreme tyranny of theology, of the phantom of God. As long as we have a master in heaven, we will be slaves on earth.
column4: Le prime revolta es contra le supreme tyrannia del theologia, del phantasma de Deo. In tanto que nos habera un domino in le celo, nos essera sclaves super le terra.

column2: It is as impossible for man to demonstrate the existence of God as it would be for even Sherlock Holmes to demonstrate the existence of Arthur Conan Doyle.
column4: Pro le homine, il es tanto impossibile demonstrar le existentia de Deo quanto il esserea, mesmo pro Sherlock Holmes, demonstrar le existentia de Arthur Conan Doyle.

column2: Theist and atheist: the fight between them is as to whether God shall be called God or shall have some other name.
column4: Theista e atheista: le lucta inter illes ha le scopo de decider si Deo debe esser appellate Deo o reciper un altere nomine.

column2: The one thing that a fish can never find is water; and the one thing that man can never find is God.
column4: Le sol cosa que un pisce non pote jammais trovar es aqua; e le sol cosa que le homine nunquam potera trovar es Deo.

column2: The world is a living image of God.
column4: Le mundo es un imagine vive de Deo.

column2: God is a metaphor for that which transcends all levels of intellectual thought. It's as simple as that.
column4: Deo es un metaphora pro illo que transcende tote le nivellos del pensamento human. Il es simplemente isto.

column2: The knower and the known are one. Simple people imagine that they should see God as if he stood there and they here. This is not so. God and I, we are one in knowledge.
column4: Ille qui cognosce e illo que es cognoscite es un sol. Personas simple imagina que Deo debe star illac, durante que illes es hic. Il non es assi. Deo e io, nos es un in cognoscimento.

column2: I do not believe in the God of theology who rewards good and punishes evil.
column4: Io non crede in le Deo del theologia, que recompensa le bono e puni le mal.

column2: I shall never believe that God plays dice with the world.
column4: Io non debera jammais creder que Deo joca al datos con le mundo.

column2: Morality is of the highest importance — but for us, not for God.
column4: Le moralitate ha le plus alte importantia — pro nos, non pro Deo.

column2: That deep emotional conviction of the presence of a superior power, which is revealed in the incomprehensible universe, forms my idea of God.
column4: Un conviction profundemente emotional del presentia de un poter superior, que se revela in le universo incomprensibile, es lo que forma mi idea de Deo.

column2: Never lose an opportunity of seeing anything beautiful, for beauty is God's handwriting.
column4: Non perde jammais un opportunitate de vider alique belle, post que le beltate es le scriptura de Deo.

column2: God may not play dice with the universe, but something strange is going on with the prime numbers.
column4: Deo forsan non joca al datos con le universo, sed alique estranie occurre con le numeros prime.

column2: The laws of nature are but the mathematical thoughts of God.
column4: Le leges del natura es solmente le pensamentos mathematic de Deo.

column2: The artist must be in his work as God is in creation, invisible and all-powerful; one must sense him everywhere but never see him.
column4: Le artista debe esser in su obra assi como Deo es in le creation, invisibile e omnipotente; on debe sentir le ubique, sed nunquam vider le.

column2: The author, in his work, must be like God in the Universe, present everywhere and visible nowhere.
column4: In su obra, le autor debe esser como Deo in le universo: presente ubique, ille non pote esser vidite in ulle loco.

column2: Every creature is a word of God.
column4: Cata creatura es un parola de Deo.

column2: The more we have the less we own.
column4: Quanto plus nos habe, tanto minus nos possede.

column2: There is no yesterday nor any tomorrow, but only Now, as it was a thousand years ago and as it will be a thousand years hence.
column4: Il ha nec ulle heri nec ulle deman, sed solmente Nunc, como il esseva mille annos retro e como il essera mille annos ab ora.

column2: And those who were seen dancing were thought to be insane by those who could not hear the music.
column4: E illes que on videva dansante ha essite considerate como folles per illes qui non poteva audir le musica.

column2: Music is a moral law. It gives soul to the universe, wings to the mind, flight to the imagination, and charm and gaiety to life and to everything.
column4: Le musica es un lege moral. Illo da anima al universo, alas al mente, volo al imagination, e incantamento e gaitate al vita e a toto.

column2: Music expresses that which cannot be said and on which it is impossible to be silent.
column4: Le musica exprime lo que non pote esser dicite e super le qual il es impossibile esser silente.

column2: A painter paints his pictures on canvas. But musicians paint their pictures on silence. We provide the music, and you provide the silence.
column4: Un pictor pinge su picturas super tela. Sed le musicos pinge lor imagines super le silentio. Nos provide le musica, e vos provide le silentio.

column2: Music in the soul can be heard by the universe.
column4: Musica in le anima pote esser audite per le universo.

column2: Without music, life would be an error. The German imagines even God singing songs.
column4: Sin musica, le vita esserea un error. Le germanos imagina que mesmo Deo canta cantos.

column2: Where words fail, music speaks.
column4: Ubi le parolas falle, le musica parla.

column2: There is geometry in the humming of the strings, there is music in the spacing of the spheres.
column4: Il ha geometria in le susurration del chordas, il ha musica in le spatiamento del spheras.

column2: It is not the situation that makes the man, but the man who makes the situation.
column4: Il non es le situation que face le homine, sed le homine qui face le situation.

column2: If you talk to a man in a language he understands, that goes to his head. If you talk to him in his language, that goes to his heart.
column4: Si nos parla a un homine in un lingua que ille comprende, illo va a su mente. Si nos le parla in su lingua, illo va a su corde.

column2: Music is the mediator between the spiritual and the sensual life.
column4: Le musica es le mediator inter le vita spiritual e le vita sensual.

column2: Music is the universal language of mankind — poetry their universal pastime and delight.
column4: Musica es le lingua universal del homines — poesia, lor passatempore e delecto universal.

column2: Music produces a kind of pleasure which human nature cannot do without.
column4: Le musica produce un sorta de placer, del qual le natura human non pote carer.

column2: Love cannot express the idea of music, while music may give an idea of love.
column4: Le amor non pote exprimer le idea de musica, sed le musica pote dar un idea de lo que es amor.

column2: I try to apply colors like words that shape poems, like notes that shape music.
column4: Io essaya de applicar colores como parolas que forma poemas, como notas que forma musica.

column2: I didn't expect to see you at a place like this.
column4: Io non expectava vider te in tal loco.

column2: Every minute counts.
column4: Cata minuta es importante.

column2: The soul is immortal.
column4: Le anima es immortal.

column2: The first sentence is the most important sentence of the book.
column4: Le prime phrase es le plus importante del libro.

column2: I finished reading this novel in under three days.
column4: Io ha finite de leger iste roman in minus de tres jornos.

column2: Smoking is not allowed inside the elevator.
column4: Il non es permittite fumar in le ascensor.

column2: He is Spanish.
column4: Ille es espaniol.

column2: I'm always listening to music; I can't live without it.
column4: Io sempre ascolta musica; io non pote viver sin illo.

column2: Music is a way to dream together and go to another dimension.
column4: Musica es un forma de soniar insimul e ir a un altere dimension.

column2: Great music is that which penetrates the ear with facility and leaves the memory with difficulty. Magical music never leaves the memory.
column4: Le grande musica es illo que penetra facilemente le aures e lassa con difficultate le memoria. Musica magic non es jammais cancellate del memoria.

column2: Music is a higher revelation than all wisdom and philosophy.
column4: Musica es un revelation plus alte que tote sapientia e philosophia.

column2: Music should strike fire from the heart of man, and bring tears from the eyes of woman.
column4: Le musica debe facer arder flammas in le corde del viro, e brillar lacrimas in le oculos del femina.

column2: Music can name the unnameable and communicate the unknowable.
column4: Le musica pote describer le indescriptibile e communicar le incognoscibile.

column2: If you look deep enough you will see music; the heart of nature being everywhere music.
column4: Si vos approfundara sufficientemente le reguardo, vos videra musica; in le corde del natura, ubique, lo que existe es musica.

column2: Music is the divine way to tell beautiful, poetic things to the heart.
column4: Musica es le manera divin de dicer cosas belle e poetic al corde.

column2: Music is the soundtrack of your life.
column4: Le musica es le banda sonor de vostre vita.

column2: There is no one standard for beauty.
column4: Il non ha ulle patrono de beltate.

column2: Are rabbits cuter than squirrels?
column4: Esque le conilios es plus gratiose que le sciuros?

column2: Music is one of those things that make us feel a little less alone in the world.
column4: Le musica es un de iste cosas que face nos sentir que nos es minus sol in le mundo.

column2: All good music resembles something. Good music stirs by its mysterious resemblance to the objects and feelings which motivated it.
column4: Tote bon musica resimila alique. Le bon musica emotiona per su mysteriose similitude al objectos e sentimentos que lo ha motivate.

column2: I may be helping to bring harmony between people through my music.
column4: Forsan io adjuta a apportar harmonia inter le personas per medio de mi musica.

column2: Music is the silence between the notes.
column4: Le musica es le silentio inter le notas.

column2: So long as the human spirit thrives on this planet, music in some living form will accompany and sustain it and give it expressive meaning.
column4: Tanto longe como le spirito human prosperara super iste planeta, le musica in qualque forma vive lo accompaniara e sustenera, e a illo dara expressive signification.

column2: Music is the arithmetic of sounds as optics is the geometry of light.
column4: Le musica es le arithmetica del sonos, assi como le optica es le geometria del luce.

column2: Music is the expression of the movement of the waters, the play of curves described by changing breezes.
column4: Le musica es le expression del movimento del aquas, del ludo del curvas descripte per le brisas inconstante.

column2: Music is an outburst of the soul.
column4: Le musica es un impulso del anima.

column2: What passions cannot music raise or quell?
column4: Que passiones le musica non pote suscitar o mitigar?

column2: Music is only love looking for words.
column4: Le musica es simplemente le amor cercante parolas.

column2: The best, most beautiful, and most perfect way that we have of expressing a sweet concord of mind to each other is by music.
column4: Le melior, le plus belle e plus perfecte maniera que nos ha de manifestar le un al altere affabile empathia es per le musica.

column2: A nation creates music — the composer only arranges it.
column4: Un nation crea musica — le compositor simplemente lo instrumenta.

column2: Music is the soul of language.
column4: Le musica es le anima del lingua.

column2: The Wedding March always reminds me of the music played when soldiers go into battle.
column4: Le Marcha Nuptial sempre me rememora le musica que on sona quando le soldatos va entrar en battalia.

column2: I don't know what could've happened.
column4: Io non sape lo que poterea haber evenite.

column2: All the world is a stage, and all the men and women merely players. They have their exits and their entrances, and one man in his time plays many parts, his acts being seven ages.
column4: Le mundo es toto un scena, e tote le viros e feminas es mer actores e actrices. Illes ha lor exitos e lor entratas, e un homine joca plure rolos durante su vita; su actos se extende super septe etates.

column2: I will never be an old man. To me, old age is always 15 years older than I am.
column4: Io non essera jammais un vetulo. Pro me, solmente es vetule un persona qui ha al minus 15 annos plus que io.

column2: All colours will agree in the dark.
column4: Omne colores conveni in le tenebras.

column2: The best part of beauty is that which no picture can express.
column4: Le melior parte del beltate es illo que nulle imagine pote monstrar.

column2: The genius, wit and spirit of a nation are discovered in its proverbs.
column4: Le ingenio, intelligentia e spirito de un nation es ponite in evidentia in su proverbios.

column2: The worst solitude is to be destitute of sincere friendship.
column4: Le pejor solitate es esser destitute de un sincer amicitate.

column2: A prudent question is one-half of wisdom.
column4: Un question ponderate es medietate de sapientia.

column2: I want you to close your eyes.
column4: Io vole que tu claude tu oculos.

column2: Don't start anything you can't finish.
column4: Non comencia ulle cosa que tu non potera finir.

column2: I bet I finish first.
column4: Io sponde que io terminara ante.

column2: My hands were full.
column4: Io habeva le manos occupate.

column2: Friends are thieves of time.
column4: Le amicos es fures de tempore.

column2: There was not one child in the park yesterday.
column4: Il habeva necun infante in le parco heri.

column2: Which planet is nearest to the Sun?
column4: Qual es le planeta le plus proxime del sol?

column2: An abacus is a tool used in counting.
column4: Le abaco es un instrumento de calculo.

column2: I don't know how Brazilians say 'aardvark' in their native tongue.
column4: Io non sape como le brasilianos dice 'aardvark' in su lingua matre.

column2: I believe, beyond a shadow of a doubt, that she is innocent.
column4: Io crede que, foras de tote dubita, illa es innocente.

column2: I'm an engineer.
column4: Io es ingeniero.

column2: That's a good excuse.
column4: Iste es un bon excusa.

column2: That's a good excuse.
column4: Isto es un bon excusa.

column2: Her speech moved us.
column4: Le discurso de illa nos ha commovite.

column2: Her speech moved us.
column4: Le discurso de illa nos ha emotionate.

column2: His speech moved us.
column4: Le discurso de ille nos ha commovite.

column2: His speech moved us.
column4: Le discurso de ille nos ha emotionate.

column2: I found that the question was easy to answer.
column4: Il me pareva facile responder al question.

column2: I used to believe everything you said.
column4: In general io credeva a toto que tu diceva.

column2: Twice and thrice had I loved thee before I knew thy face or name.
column4: Multe vices habe io amate vos ante que io cognosceva tu facie o nomine.

column2: He must pull out his own eyes, and see no creature, before he can say, he sees no God. He must be no man, and quench his reasonable soul, before he can say to himself, there is no God.
column4: Alicuno debe eveller su proprie oculos, e vider necun creatura, ante que ille pote dicer que ille vide necun Deo. Alicuno debe esser necun homine, e extinguer su anima rational, ante que ille pote dicer a se ipse que Deo non existe.

column2: Humiliation is the beginning of sanctification.
column4: Le humiliation es le comenciamento del sanctification.

column2: No man is an island, entire of itself; every man is a piece of the continent.
column4: Necun homine es un insula, integre in se ipse; cata homine es un parte del continente.

column2: I am a little world made cunningly of elements, and an angelic sprite.
column4: Io es un parve mundo habilemente facite de elementos, e un spirito angelic.

column2: Why were you talking to him?
column4: Proque tu parlava con ille?

column2: Why were you talking to her?
column4: Proque tu parlava con illa?

column2: Her boyfriend was really angry at her.
column4: Su amico esseva irate contra illa.

column2: His girlfriend was really angry at him.
column4: Su amica esseva vermente irate contra ille.

column2: Most of this building's tenants are artists.
column4: Le majoritate del locatarios de iste edificio es artistas.

column2: As peace is of all goodness, so war is an emblem, a hieroglyphic, of all misery.
column4: Assi como le pace es un symbolo de omne bonitate, le guerra es un emblema, un hieroglyphico, de omne miseria.

column2: Death comes equally to us all, and makes us all equal when it comes.
column4: Le morte veni equalmente a nos totes, e illo nos equala totes quando illo veni.

column2: Everyone's in the buff, in there.
column4: Tote le mundo es nude in illac.

column2: Nations have their ego, just like individuals.
column4: Le nationes ha lor ego, assi como le individuos.

column2: Christopher Columbus, as everyone knows, is honored by posterity because he was the last to discover America.
column4: Christophoro Columbo, como totes sape, es honorate per le posteritate proque ille esseva le ultime discoperitor de America.

column2: He found in the world without as actual what was in his world within as possible.
column4: Ille ha trovate in le mundo exterior, como realitate, lo que esseva in su mundo interior, como possibilitate.

column2: Love loves to love love.
column4: Le amo amas amar le amo.

column2: The actions of men are the best interpreters of their thoughts.
column4: Le actiones del homines es le melior interpretes de lor pensamentos.

column2: I couldn't help yawning.
column4: Io non poteva non oscitar.

column2: I couldn't help yawning.
column4: Io non ha potite non oscitar.

column2: Youth is always right. Those who follow the counsels of youth are wise.
column4: Le juventute ha sempre ration. Il es prudente sequer le consilios del juvenes.

column2: The rocket blew up a few seconds after launch.
column4: Le rocchetta explodeva pauc secundas post le lanceamento.

column2: The rocket blew up a few seconds after launch.
column4: Le rocchetta ha explodite poc secundas post le lanceamento.

column2: Tom's little brother has always looked up to him.
column4: Su parve fratre sempre le ha admirate.

column2: I came across some old family photos when I was cleaning out the closet.
column4: Io incontrava alcun vetere photos de familia quando io nettava le guarda-roba.

column2: There are a lot of kids in that family and most of them wear hand-me-downs.
column4: Il ha multe infantes in ille familia e le majoritate de illos usa vestimentos de secunde mano.

column2: The school is not quite deserted, said the Ghost. "A solitary child, neglected by his friends, is left there still."

column2: When Scrooge awoke, it was so dark, that looking out of bed, he could scarcely distinguish the transparent window from the opaque walls of his chamber.

column2: What is the matter? asked the Spirit. "Nothing," said Scrooge. "Nothing. There was a boy singing a Christmas Carol at my door last night. I should like to have given him something: that's all."

column2: Many social and political problems in France contributed to the causes of the French Revolution.
column4: Multes del problemas social e politic de Francia contribueva al causas del Revolution Francese.

column2: During the reigns of Kings Louis XV and Louis XVI, France supported the English colonists in their resistance against the London government not because of an admiration for democracy but because the French wanted to weaken the British, who, for a long period of time, had been the enemies of the Government of France.
column4: Durante le regnos del reges Louis XV e Louis XVI, Francia appoiava le colonos anglese in lor resistentia contra le governamento de London no a causa de un admiration del franceses pro le democratia ma proque illes voleva debilitar le britannicos, qui, durante un longe periodo de tempore, habeva essite le inimicos del governamento de Francia.

column2: But the high price of bread led to mass starvation among the common people of France, who resented the rich nobles of the country who had the money needed to eat well and build huge mansions while they had to sleep on the streets.
column4: Ma le alte precio del pan conduceva al fame massive inter le gente commun de Francia, qui resentiva le nobles ric del pais, qui habeva le moneta necessari pro mangiar ben e construer enorme mansiones, durante que illes debeva dormir in le stratas.

column2: The Roman Catholic Church, which owned a large part of the most desirable land in France, also imposed heavy taxes on the poor and hungry among the French.
column4: Le Ecclesia Catholic Roman, que esseva le proprietario de un grande parte del terra le plus desirabile de Francia, anque imponeva forte impostos al gente le plus povre e famelic inter le franceses.

column2: Increasing numbers of people in France resented the absolute rule by the king and the nobles of France.
column4: Numeros crescente de personas in Francia resentiva le controlo absolute del pais per le rege absolute e le noblessa de Francia.

column2: They noted the revolutionary success of the former English colonists who were able to achieve independence from the British and wanted to do the same thing in France.
column4: Illes notava le successo revolutionari del ancian colonos anglese in le Statos Unite qui habeva potite ganiar lor independentia del angleses e voleva facer lo mesmo in Francia

column2: They also wanted freedom of religion because of the heavy oppression of the Catholic Church. Over time these social pressures caused a revolution in France.
column4: Illes anque voleva le libertate de religion a causa del oppression del Ecclesia Catholic. Con le tempore iste pressiones social causava un revolution in Francia.

column2: Napoleon Bonaparte is considered to be one of the greatest military geniuses of world history.
column4: Napoleon Bonaparte es considerate como un del major genios militar del historia del mundo.

column2: But despite his victories in an important series of wars in many parts of Europe, Napoleon suffered some very serious losses.
column4: Ma in despecto de su victorias in un importante serie de guerras in multe partes de Europa, Napoleon anque habeva alicun defaites multo grave.

column2: The only political or military leader who has had an equally significant impact on the history of Europe is Adolf Hitler, who was more destructive than Napoleon, who at least had some accomplishments of lasting usefulness.
column4: Le sol leader politic o militar qui ha habite un impacto equalmente significative in le historia de Europa es Adolf Hitler, qui esseva plus destructive que Napoleon, qui al minus habeva alicun complimentos durabile.

column2: Napoleon is remembered for his establishment of France's Napoleonic Code, which has had a great influence on the legal systems of other countries. In the US, for example, the legal system of the State of Louisiana is based on the Napoleonic Code.
column4: Napoleon es famose pro su creation del Codice de Napoleon de Francia, que ha habite un grande influentia in le ordenamentos juridic de altere paises. In le Statos Unite, pro exemplo, le systema legal del stato de Louisiana se basa in le Codice Napoleonic.

column2: Among his most important achievements were his reforms of the education system in France with the establishment of the "grandes écoles ".
column4: Inter su complimentos le plus importante esseva su reformas al systema educative in Francia con le establimento del "grandes écoles".

column2: According to some historians, Napoleon was an enlightened despot because of improvements he made in the social institutions of France. Others denounce him as an egocentric dictator because of the large number of people who died in his wars.
column4: Secun alicun historicos, Napoleon esseva un despota illustrate a causa del melioramentos que ille faceva al institutiones social de Francia. Alteres le condemna como un dictator egocentric a causa del grande numero de personas qui moriva in su guerras.

column2: But it is undeniable that his influence on French history has been tremendous, and many of the institutions that Napoleon established are still incredibly important in contemporary French society.
column4: Ma il es innegabile que su influencia in le histora de Francia ha essite enorme, e multes del institutiones que Napoleon establiva continua a esser incredibilemente importante in le societate francese contemporanee.

column2: A team of British scientists has discovered what is apparently a “strong correlation” between a person's beliefs and the structure of his or her brain.
column4: Un equipa de scientistas britannic ha discoperite lo que apparentemente demonstra que il ha un forte correlation inter le credentias de un persona e le structura de su cerebro.

column2: They identified two brain areas with sizes that are apparently associated with the ideas and political values of an individual.
column4: Illes identificava duo areas del cerebro con un grandor que es apparentemente relationate con le ideas e le valores politic del persona.

column2: The scientists used a group of students in their study. They discovered that students who described themselves as social and economic liberals had a greater density of gray matter in a brain region called the anterior cingulate.
column4: Le scientistas utilisava un gruppo de studentes in lor studio. Illes discoperiva que le studentes qui se describe como liberales social e economic habeva un densitate plus grande del materia gris in un region del cerebro nominate le cortice cingulate anterior.

column2: And young people who described themselves as conservative had an amygdala (the brain structure associated with emotional processing) that was larger.
column4: E le juvenes qui se describeva como conservatores habeva un amigdala (le structura del cerebro associate con le processamento emotional) que esseva plus grande.

column2: The researchers do not know, however, whether the structure of a person's brain determines his or her political beliefs or whether the political beliefs come first and the modified brain structures come later as a consequence of the development of these political beliefs.
column4: Le investigatores non sape, nonobstante, si le structura del cerebro de un persona determina su credentias politic o si le credentias politic veni primo e le structuras modificate del cerebro veni postea como consequentia del disveloppamento de iste credentias politic.

column2: Julius Caesar was born in the year 100 B.C. The exact date of his birth is not known. At age sixteen he had to take care of all of his family.
column4: Julio Caesare nasceva in le anno 100 a.C. Le data exacte de su nascimento non es cognoscite. Al etate de dece e septe annos ille debeva custodiar omne su familia.

column2: At about this time, Lucius Cornelius Sulla, after becoming the dictator of Rome, thought that Caesar was a political threat to his rule.
column4: A iste epocha Lucio Cornelio Sulla, post devenir le dictator de Roma, pensava que Caesar esseva un menacia politic a su regno.

column2: Sulla began to kill his enemies, and Caesar was on list of the people that he was going to kill. Caesar’s mother’s family begged for his life, and Sulla, reluctantly, spared him. Then Caesar joined the Roman army and returned after Sulla’s death.
column4: Sulla comenciava a occider su inimicos, e Caesare se trovava in le lista del gente que Sulla iva a occider. Le Familia del matre de Caesare supplicava pro su vita, e Sulla, multo reluctantemente, le perdonava. Caesare tunc se inrolava in le armea roman e retornava a Roma post le morte de Sulla.

column2: After a brief interlude, Caesar decided to join the army once again and left Rome. While he was sailing across the sea, a group of pirates kidnapped him.
column4: Post un breve interludio, Caesare decideva reinrolar se in le armea e quittava Roma. Durante que ille navigava trans le mar, un gruppo de piratas le sequestrava.

column2: During his captivity he made a promise to the pirates that he would eventually kill them. The pirates thought that this was only a joke. After he was ransomed, Caesar pursued and captured the pirates and ordered their crucifixion.
column4: Durante su captivitate ille faceva un promissa al piratas que al fin ille les occiderea. Le piratas pensava que isto esseva solmente un burla. Post esser rescatate, Caesare les chassava e mandava lor crucifixion.

column2: Caesar’s audacity was the beginning of a very distinguished military and political career. In time, like Alexander the Great and Napoleon Bonapart, he became one of the most famous figures in world history.
column4: Le audacia de Caesare esseva le comenciamento de un carriera militar e politic multo distinguite. Con le tempore, como Alexandro Magno e Napoleon Bonaparte, ille finalmente deveniva un del figuras le plus famose del historia del mundo.

column2: Galileo Galilei was an Italian astronomer and an important figure in the initial development of the modern sciences. His discoveries contradicted the teachings of the Catholic Church, and Galileo was put on trial for heresy by the Inquisition.
column4: Galileo Galilei esseva un astronomo italian e un figura importante in le disveloppamento initial del scientias moderne. Su discoperimentos contradiceva le doctrinas del Ecclesia Catholic, e Galileo esseva processate pro heresia per le Inquisition.

column2: Some people believe that Galileo was the first person who built a telescope. While this is not true, he was the first person who published his observations of astronomical objects through a telescope.
column4: Alicun personas crede que Galileo esseva le prime persona qui construeva un telescopio. Ben que isto non es ver, ille esseva le prime persona qui publicava su observationes de objectos astronomic usante un telescopio.

column2: Galileo discovered that the Milky Way is made of many stars and that the Moon has hills. He discovered four moons in orbit around Jupiter, which are now known as the Galilean satellites.
column4: Galileo discoperiva que le Via Lactee se trova componite de multe stellas e que le Luna ha collinas. Ille discoperiva quatro lunas in orbita circum Jupiter, que nunc se cognosce como le satellites galilean.

column2: He also discovered sunspots, the dark areas of the Sun. He saw that the planet Venus has light and dark phases just like the Moon. These discoveries provided empirical information that proved that the Sun is at the center of the Solar System, as Nicholas Copernicus had predicted.
column4: Ille anque discoperiva le maculas solar, le zonas obscur del Sol. Ille videva que le planeta Venus ha phases luminose e obscur exactemente como le Luna. Iste discoperimentos provideva information empiric que demonstrava que le Sol se trova in le centro del Systema Solar, como Nicholas Copernico habeva predicite.

column2: The Almanac de Interlingua is a free, independent monthly publication whose goal is to supply reading material for anyone interested in learning or practicing Interlingua. Those interested in receiving the Almanac must send a request to the editor by email.

column2: Interlingua is an international auxiliary language developed between 1937 and 1951 by the IALA (International Auxiliary Language Association). Its vocabulary and grammar is chiefly derived from five control languages: English, Spanish, Portuguese, French, and Italian.
column4: Interlingua es un lingua international auxiliar disveloppate inter le annos 1937 e 1951 per IALA (International Auxiliary Language Association). Su vocabulario e grammatica deriva principalmente de cinque linguas de controllo: anglese, espaniol, portugese, francese e italiano.

column2: A Story on Another Planet: On a faraway planet, there are two moons in the night sky, Dainty and Heavy. A child asketh the father, "Dearest father, why are there two moons in the sky?" Saith the father, "Oh, what kind of question is that? How many eyes hast thou? 'Tis two. How many hands hast thou? 'Tis two." The child respondeth, "But, father, I have but one nose..."
column4: Un conto sur un altere planeta: Sur un multo distante planeta, il ha duo lunas in le nocturne celo, Legier e Pesante. Un infante demanda a su patre, "Car Papa, proque il ha duo lunas in le celo?" Le patre dice, "Oh, que typo de question es illo? Quante oculas ha tu? Il ha duo. Quante manos ha tu? Il ha duo.” Le infante responde, "Ma, Papa, ego ha solmente un naso..."
